在米尔本和柯比的分析中，科学与科幻之间的互动是辩证的。科幻从已知的科学技术出发，设想未来更强大的版本，而科幻的叙事世界则向公众展现了一种尖端科技的景象，这种科技已经变得习以为常，成为未来日常生活的一部分。小说可以引发人们对特定可能性的信念和兴奋，这通常是确保研究获得物质支持或确保消费者对新产品渴望的重要因素。产品出现时，他们会立即知道产品何时出现。10也许最著名的例子是苹果 Macintosh 电脑的原始广告，该广告于 1984 年 1 月 22 日在超级碗期间播出。该广告由因具有影响力的《银翼杀手》（1982 年）而闻名于科幻界的雷德利·斯科特执导，该广告在一分钟的叙述中影射了奥威尔的《一九八四》，以在大众想象中形成 IBM（与企业霸主、僵化和墨守成规有关）与苹果（与青春活力、创造力和选择自由相关）之间的对比——这些特征在三十五年后依然存在。11一个不那么引人注目但经常被讨论的例子是史蒂文·斯皮尔伯格的《少数派报告》 （2002 年）中用于管理多个数据屏幕的手势界面。它不仅预见了——或许还预示了——智能手机和智能家居时代的到来，而且也成为了科幻小说内外高科技世界中显示数据的标准方式。12

In both Milburn’s and Kirby’s analyses, the exchanges between science and sf are dialectical. The sf extrapolates from known science and technology to imagine even more powerful versions in the future, while the narrative world of sf introduces the public to a vision of cutting-edge technology that has become normalized, just part of everyday life in such futures. Fiction can induce belief in and excitement about specific possibilities, often an important element for securing material support for the research in the first place or for ensuring consumer desire for new products when they appear.10 Perhaps the most famous example of this is the original advertisement for Apple’s Macintosh computer, aired during the Super Bowl on January 22, 1984. Directed by Ridley Scott, renowned in the sf world for his influential Blade Runner (1982), the commercial alludes to Orwell’s Nineteen Eighty-Four in a single minute of narrative to establish a contrast in the popular imagination between IBM (linked to corporate overlords, inflexibility, and conventionality) versus Apple (associated with youthful energy, creativity, and freedom of choice)—characterizations that persist thirty-five years later.11 A less dramatic, but frequently discussed example is the gestural interface used to manage multiple screens of data in Steven Spielberg’s Minority Report (2002). Not only did it anticipate—perhaps inform—a coming world of smart phones and smart homes, but it also became a standard way to display data in high-tech worlds both in and beyond sf.12

自本世纪中叶以来，随着阿尔文·托夫勒的《未来的冲击》（1970年）等耸人听闻的书籍，以及兰德公司（成立于1948年）等面向二战后日益全球化的世界的战略规划举措的出现，政府、企业和个人开始将世界概念化为由技术驱动的快速变化，并需要未来主义思维来应对这种变化。大约在同一时期，未来学学科未来研究开始受到一些机构的青睐，通常借鉴科幻作家的推测和评论。未来学家和智库开始探讨环境或人口变化的问题——例如广受讨论的罗马俱乐部报告《增长的极限》（1972 年）——当代科幻小说也提出了类似的问题。企业预见的实践基于一些方法，这些方法可以很容易地描述通过推断来撰写科幻故事的实践：开展研究以预测变化；使用情景分析来规划和比较一系列可能的未来以及影响哪些未来会实现的因素；以及原型设计，最近具体来说是“科幻原型设计”（由布赖恩·戴维·约翰逊提出的术语），它使用叙事来思考新设计的可能性和风险。13这一历史事件建立在科幻作家受邀参加智库和政府咨询小组的历史之上，其中最臭名昭著的是里根总统的国家太空政策公民咨询委员会，该委员会提出了战略防御计划（又名星球大战）和被称为“相互确保生存”（1984 年）的支持核扩散的论点，与当时盛行的核裁军口号“相互确保摧毁”形成了鲜明对比。14

From midcentury on, with sensationalizing books such as Alvin Toffler’s Future Shock (1970) and with strategy planning initiatives, such as that of the RAND Corporation (founded in 1948), oriented toward an increasingly globalized world following the Second World War, governments, corporations, and individuals have conceptualized the world in terms of rapid change driven by technology and a need for futuristic thinking to be prepared for such change. About the same time the discipline of futurology or future studies began to have some institutional purchase, often drawing on the speculations and commentary of sf writers. Futurologists and think tanks took on questions of environmental or population change—such as the widely discussed Club of Rome report Limits to Growth (1972)—and contemporary sf asked similar questions. The practice of corporate foresight is based on methodologies that could as easily describe the practice of extrapolating to write a science fiction story: conducting research to anticipate change; using scenario analysis to map out and compare a range of possible futures and the factors that influence which materializes; and prototyping, more recently specifically “science-fiction prototyping” (a term proposed by Brian David Johnson), which uses narrative to think through the possibilities and risks of the new design.13 This builds on a history of sf authors being invited to participate in think tanks and government advisory panels, mostly notoriously President Reagan’s Citizens Advisory Council on National Space Policy, which gave us the Strategic Defense Initiative (aka Star Wars) and a pro-nuclear proliferation argument dubbed Mutually Assured Survival (1984), in fixed counterpoint to the prevalent nuclear disarmament slogan “mutually assured destruction.”14

正如科学与科幻小说之间的交流一样，未来研究等领域的实践者希望将他们对叙事外推的运用指定为比科幻小说更为严肃或严谨。当然，他们也谈到他们的作品面向不同的受众，并且他们的介入所带来的利害关系也大相径庭；尽管如此，对推断技术的未来并由此建设更美好世界的严肃承诺始终是科幻作家和科幻社区的一部分。这些新规则的制度合法性不断提高，这是最新颖的。一些科幻作家，最著名的是大卫·布林和布鲁斯·斯特林，他们对于未来的非虚构评论和小说一样出名，而该领域的许多新作家，如安娜莉·纽维茨和安妮·查诺克，在成为科学记者和评论员之后转向小说创作。在这样的圈子里，叙事只是众多话语中的一种，通过它可以探讨科学、技术、人类价值观和我们即将到来的未来的交汇之处。虚构推断、社会技术预测和叙事说服力之间的界限也同样模糊，这在最近的一些电视节目中也很明显，这些节目是科幻剧和纪录片的混合体，由与教育内容相关的专业频道制作：《未来景观》（科学频道 2013 年）、《火星》（国家地理 2016 年、2018 年）和《突破》（国家地理 2015 年、2017 年）。

As in exchanges between science and science fiction, practitioners in fields such as future studies desire to designate their use of narrative extrapolation as more serious or rigorous than that done by sf. Certainly, they address their work to different audiences and with significantly divergent stakes attached to their interventions; nonetheless, serious commitment to extrapolating the future of technology and thereby building a better world has always been a part of sf writers and communities. The increased institutional legitimacy of these new rubrics is what is most novel. Some sf writers, most prominently David Brin and Bruce Sterling, have become known as much for their nonfiction commentary on the future as for their fiction, while many newer writers in the field, such as Annalee Newitz and Anne Charnock, turned to fiction after establishing themselves as science journalists and commentators. In such circles, narrative is just one of many discourses through which to grapple with the intersections of science, technology, human values, and our coming future. A similar blurring of lines among fictional extrapolation, sociotechnical forecasting, and the persuasive power of narrative is evident in a number of recent television programs that are hybrids between sf drama and documentary, produced by specialty channels associated with education content: Futurescape (Science Channel 2013), Mars (National Geographic 2016, 2018), and Breakthrough (National Geographic 2015, 2017).

朱利安·布利克（Julian Bleeker）提出的“设计小说”一词引发了一系列类似的关于想象力、科技、叙事和未来的讨论。布利克认为，设计是一种创造性的实践，它可以“揭示新的经验、新的社会实践，或者……反思今天，思考创新的、新的、宜居的未来。” 15他主张这些电视剧所体现的设计实践：介于事实与虚构之间、既可信又具有推测性的故事。布利克认为，科学事实和科幻小说是“实现同一目标的两种方法——将想法和想象力具体化的两种方式”，并呼吁一种“推测性设计”的实践，就像约翰逊的科幻原型一样，创造了对话和进一步思考的背景。16布利克的愿景的独特之处在于他强调制作实物，强调设计的触感，对他来说，这与叙事一样重要，都是将想法从抽象概念推向现实世界的应用。

A similar set of conversations about imagination, technology, narrative, and the future constellates around the term “design fiction,” proposed by Julian Bleeker. Design is a creative practice, Bleeker argues, that can “[r]eveal new experiences, new social practices, or . . . reflect upon today to contemplate innovative, new, habitable futures.”15 He argues for the design practice exemplified by these television series: stories somewhere between fact and fiction, both plausible and speculative. Bleeker contends that science fact and science fiction are “two approaches to accomplishing the same goal—two ways of materializing ideas and the imagination” and calls for a practice of “speculative design” that, like Johnson’s sf prototyping, creates contexts for conversation and further contemplation.16 What is distinctive about Bleeker’s vision is his emphasis on making physical objects, on the tactility of design, which for him is as important as narrative for pushing ideas from abstract concept to real-world use.

在《思辨万物》（2013）一书中，安东尼·邓恩和菲奥娜·拉比将这一观点推向了更远，他们认为思辨是一种重塑设计实践的方式，将其从用于改善产品功能性和消费者吸引力的技术推向“设计作为社会梦想的催化剂”。17在他们的序言中，他们提供了一份“A 列表”，列出了传统设计所具备的品质，以及一份“B 列表”，列出了思辨性设计可能成为的样子。他们列出的差异包括“服务于工业”的设计（A 列表）与“服务于社会”的设计（B 列表）；“为了世界现状”的设计（A）与“世界可能成为的样子”的设计（B）；面向“作为消费者”的个人以促使我们购买的设计（A）与构想“公民”并引发我们思考（B）。邓恩和拉比将科幻小说放在A面，或许是考虑到一些科幻小说拥护技术官僚观点的方式，或者未来学如何运用科幻技巧来强化政治和经济现状。在B面，他们列出了“社会小说”，但他们并未对这个词进行定义。正如我上文所述，许多科幻作品与拉比和邓恩的思辨设计项目相符，旨在打破既有世界的权力结构，为更美好的世界开辟道路。事实上，随着读者进一步阅读他们的著作，会发现他们使用的语言与布洛赫式的乌托邦研究语言相呼应：例如，他们写道：“批判性设计通过作用于人们的想象力而非物质世界，旨在挑战人们对日常生活的思考方式。在此过程中，它努力通过提供与我们周围世界的对比，并鼓励我们看到日常生活可以有所不同，从而保持其他可能性。” 18这或许也是对第二章所讨论的科幻小说中乌托邦传统的描述。

In Speculative Everything (2013), Anthony Dunne and Fiona Raby take this idea even further, arguing that speculation is a way to reinvent the practice of design, pushing it from techniques used to improve the functionality and consumer appeal of products, toward “design as a catalyst for social dreaming.”17 In their preface, they offer an “A list” of qualities of design as conventionally practiced and a “B list” of what it might become, conceived speculatively. Among the difference they chart are designs “in the service of industry” (A list) vs. “in the service of society” (B list); design “for how the world is” (A) vs. “how the world could be” (B); design that addresses the individual “as consumer” to make us buy (A) vs. design that conceives of the “citizen” and makes us think (B). Dunne and Raby put science fiction on the A side, perhaps thinking of the ways that some sf has championed technocratic views or how futurology’s use of sf techniques seeks to reinforce the political and economic status quo. On their B side they list “social fiction,” a term they do not define. As I argue above, many works of science fiction are consistent with Raby and Dunne’s speculative design project, aimed at disrupting the power structures of the given world to make way for a better one. Indeed, as one reads further into their book, the language they use echoes the language of Blochian utopian studies: for example, they write, “By acting on peoples’ imaginations rather than the material world, critical design aims to challenge how people think about everyday life. In doing this, it strives to keep alive other possibilities by providing a counterpoint to the world around us and encouraging us to see that everyday life could be different.”18 This might also be a description of the utopian tradition in sf discussed in chapter 2.

贯穿于各种未来主义思辨话语（科幻小说、思辨设计、预见性、广告、乌托邦主义、行动主义）的核心主题，是当下选择与未来世界之间的关系。所有这些话语都基于一个信念：我们现在的选择将塑造未来的世界。更重要的是，然而，他们坚持认为，想象力对于选择活动至关重要，并以双重和辩证的方式。对未来可能性的憧憬，无论正面还是负面，都会促进情感依恋，影响观看方式，并将注意力和精力集中到项目中，将其培育成物质性或抵制其到来。塑造未来的斗争不仅是物质性的：它同样是情感性的和想象力性的，而科幻小说的推断和叙事沉浸模式正是这一努力的有力工具。科幻叙事中的推测性预测让我们为未来做好准备，使我们能够在叙事中间接体验新技术或新社会安排的各个方面，从而准备好在实践中与之互动。这些未来的具体内容及其所设想的目标各不相同；有些运用科幻元素来强化现状，并确保同样的精英、企业和行业在变革中仍然能够盈利；而另一些则利用推测向我们展示，既有世界中看似不可动摇的固定装置是如何被重新设计的。

The key motif that persists across these various futuristic speculative discourses—science fiction, speculative design, foresight, advertising, utopianism, activism—is the relationship between present choices and future worlds. All are premised on the belief that the choices we make now shape the world to come. More importantly, however, they insist on the crucial importance of the imagination to the activity of choosing, in a doubled and dialectical way. Visions of possible futures, positive and negative, promote affective attachments, inform ways of seeing, and marshal attention and energy to projects, nurturing them into materiality or resisting their arrival. The struggle to shape the future is not only material: it is equally affective and imaginative, and sf modes of extrapolation and narrative immersion are powerful tools in this endeavor. Speculative projections through sf narrative prepare us for the future, enabling us to experience aspects of new technologies or new social arrangements vicariously in narrative so that we are ready to engage with them in practice. The particular content of these futures and the destinations they have in mind vary; some deploy science fictionality to reinforce the status quo and ensure that the same elites, corporations, and industries remain profitable despite change, while others use speculation to show us how seemingly immovable fixtures of the given world are open to redesign.

塑造未来的斗争不仅是物质的：它同样是情感的和想象的，而科幻模式的推断和叙事沉浸是强有力的工具。

The struggle to shape the future is not only material: it is equally affective and imaginative, and sf modes of extrapolation and narrative immersion are powerful tools.

随着科学实践者和科学研究学者都认识到想象力和叙事的重要性，科学事实与科幻小说的这种混杂在21世纪愈演愈烈。尤其是自社交媒体兴起以来，日常生活开始变得像科幻小说所预想的世界一样。上一代人的经历提醒我们，那些构建网络世界基础设施的人，成长于一个有着悠久科幻传统的文化中。科幻小说已从二十世纪初的小众类型，转变为描述二十一世纪广泛使用的文化术语。从许多方面来看，科幻小说不再是一个专门的体裁，而是如今分析一个科技发展速度超过我们自身变化的世界的主导方式。

This promiscuous mingling of science fact and science fiction has intensified into the twenty-first century, as both science practitioners and science studies scholars recognize the importance of imagination and narrative. Especially since the emergence of social media, daily life has started to resemble worlds anticipated by the sf of an earlier generation, reminding us that those who built the infrastructure of the networked world grew up in a culture with an established tradition of sf. Science fiction has moved from being a niche genre at the beginning of the twentieth century to a widely shared cultural vernacular for describing the twenty-first. In many ways, sf is no longer a specialized genre, but now the dominant way to analyze a world in which our technology changes faster than we do.

4

4

殖民者的想象力

The Colonial Imagination

科幻想象力的灵感不仅源于社会价值观和政治结构，也源于科学技术的变革。这一事实在当今设计小说和无处不在的媒体技术的世界里依然存在，就像早期科幻小说一样，它们诞生于当时新颖的科学理念，例如进化论和新的移动技术。20世纪20年代，当根斯巴克寻求将科幻小说作为一种独立体裁的认可时，他提出，这种写作和思维风格在赫伯特·乔治·威尔斯、埃德加·爱伦·坡和儒勒·凡尔纳的19世纪晚期作品中就已经存在。1罗杰·勒克赫斯特的《科幻小说》（2005）列举了一系列令人信服的理由，说明为什么这一时期已经为一种后来被称为科幻小说的新文学模式做好了准备，这种模式强调文化背景与文学形式的相互作用：

The sf imagination takes its cue as much from social values and political structures as from changes in science and technology, a fact that is true in today’s world of design fiction and ubiquitous media technology as much as it was true for early sf that emerged from then-novel scientific ideas such as evolution and new technologies of mobility. When Gernsback sought recognition for sf as a separate genre in the 1920s, he did so by arguing that this style of writing and thinking already existed in the late-nineteenth-century work of H. G. Wells, Edgar Allan Poe, and Jules Verne.1 Roger Luckhurst’s Science Fiction (2005) offers a compelling list of reasons why this period was ready for a new literary mode that would come to be called science fiction, which foregrounds the interplay of cultural context and literary form:

（1）识字率和初等教育的普及覆盖了英美两国的大多数人口，包括工人阶级；（2）廉价杂志取代了旧式的大众文学，例如“廉价惊悚小说”和“廉价小说”，新的廉价杂志版式推动了形式上的革新，并催生了侦探小说、间谍小说以及科幻小说等现代文学类型；（3）科技机构的出现，为中下阶层培养科学工作者、教师和工程师，并开始挑战传统的文化权威地位；（4）与此明显相关的是，科技创新明显地改变了文化背景，这种创新首次真正开始以机械的方式渗透到几乎所有人的日常生活体验中。2

(1) the extension of literacy and primary education to the majority of the population of England and America, including the working classes; (2) the displacement of the older forms of mass literature, the ‘penny dreadful’ and the ‘dime novel’, with new cheap magazine formats that force formal innovation, and drive the invention of modern genre categories like detective or spy fiction as well as SF; (3) the arrival of scientific and technical institutions that provide a training for a lower-middle-class generation as scientific workers, teachers and engineers, and that comes to confront traditional loci of cultural authority; and, in a clearly related way, (4) the context of a culture being visibly transformed by technological and scientific innovations that, really for the first time, begin to saturate the everyday life experience of nearly all with Mechanism.2

伴随日常生活​​中这些变化而来的还有新的世界观和道德框架，这在卢克赫斯特关于新的科学导向人群如何挑战“传统文化权威中心”的描述中有所暗示。

Concomitant with these changes in daily life were new world views and ethical frameworks, hinted at in Luckhurst’s description of how new scientifically oriented populations challenged “traditional loci of cultural authority.”

约翰·里德在《殖民主义与科幻小说的兴起》（2008）一书中，关注了帝国主义——这种文化权威的一部分——所发挥的关键作用。3他为科幻小说的兴起条件添加了第五个必要条件，即欧洲殖民主义。在里德看来，哥白尼式的日心说宇宙模型的出现，以及伽利略发明望远镜所激发的广泛文化兴趣，标志着欧洲文化的一次关键转变。里德承认，早期关于外星旅行的讽刺作品，例如《大鼻子情圣》中的讽刺作品，并没有展现出根斯巴克传统后来将其定义为科幻小说核心的、可信的科学推断。对里德来说，变革性的“与其说是哥白尼将地球从太阳系中心移开，不如说是大鼻子情圣将自己的文化从人类中心移开。” 4他认为，这种“对民族中心主义的干扰，即实现一种将自身文化视为众多可能文化之一的视角”，是科幻小说诞生时被忽视的一个条件。5他进一步推测，当科幻小说在十九世纪后期形成一种可识别的体裁时，它仍然深受这种认知转变的影响，其特点是“殖民凝视”，它“将知识和​​权力分配给观看的主体，同时否认或最小化被观看者获得权力的机会。” 6里德的观点是，殖民主义虽然只是有时在科幻小说的内容或主题中显现出来——外星人遭遇、行星外殖民——但它始终是科幻形式的组成部分，“是该体裁结构的一部分，是其对历史的错位指涉、对意识形态生产的参与以及对可能性和可想象性的建构中一个持久而重要的组成部分。” 7

John Rieder draws attention to the pivotal role of imperialism, part of such cultural authority, in Colonialism and the Emergence of Science Fiction (2008).3 He adds a necessary fifth item to the conditions for sf’s emergence, namely European colonialism. For Rieder, the Copernican model of a heliocentric universe and the widespread cultural interest provoked by Galileo’s invention of the telescope marks a crucial shift for European cultures. Rieder acknowledges that early satires about journeys to other planets, such as those by Cyrano, do not exhibit the plausible scientific extrapolation that the Gernsback tradition would later define as central to sf. For Rieder, what is transformative “has far less to do with Copernicus’s taking the Earth out of the center of the solar system than with Cyrano’s taking his own culture out of the center of the human race.”4 He contends that this “disturbance of ethnocentrism, the achievement of a perspective from which one’s own culture is only one of a number of possible cultures” is an overlooked condition for sf’s emergence.5 He goes on to theorize that when sf coheres as a recognizable genre in the late nineteenth century, it remains deeply shaped by this cognitive shift, characterized by “the colonial gaze” that “distributes knowledge and power to the subject who looks, while denying or minimizing access to power for its object, the one looked at.”6 Rieder’s point is that colonialism, although only sometimes evident in the content or topic of sf—alien encounter, extraplanetary colonization—is always constitutive of its form, “a part of the genre’s texture, a persistent, important component of its displaced references to history, its engagement in ideological production, and its construction of the possible and the imaginable.”7

殖民主义与科幻小说之间的这种构成关系既带来了问题，也带来了机遇。民族中心主义态度的扰乱，为思考日常生活如何才能彻底改变创造了空间，但它也常常成为在不同文化之间建立等级制度的借口；例如，达尔文主义思想的颠覆，就被社会达尔文主义者用来为奴隶制和其他种族剥削行为提供托辞。赫伯特·乔治·威尔斯的《世界大战》（1898）是外星人入侵的典型文本，它从当代未来战争故事的传统中推断，阐明了这一殖民基础。8拥有先进技术的火星人入侵，震惊了自鸣得意的英国帝国主义势力，他们最先进的装备在火星武器面前显得微不足道。开篇讽刺了人们自满地认为英国文化永远会超越它所遇到的任何其他文化：尽管人类“幻想火星上可能还有其他人，也许比他们低劣，并准备欢迎传教事业”，但他们完全没有准备好去思考“对人类优先事项漠不关心的、冷漠的智力”。9威尔斯的叙述者详细描述了入侵给英国人民造成的暴力后果，呼吁读者记住“我们自己物种造成了多么无情的彻底毁灭”，不仅对现已灭绝的动物，而且对殖民地人口也是如此：“塔斯马尼亚人，尽管与人类相似，但在战争中被彻底消灭欧洲移民在五十年间发动的灭绝行动。” 10

This constitutive relationship between colonialism and sf creates both problems and opportunities. The disturbance of an ethnocentric attitude creates space for thinking about how daily life could be radically different, but it has often served as a warrant to institute hierarchies among cultures; for example, the disruption of Darwinian ideas was co-opted into social Darwinist alibis for slavery and other racialized exploitations. H. G. Wells’s The War of the Worlds (1898), the paradigmatic text of alien invasion, extrapolates from a contemporary tradition of future war stories to make this colonial foundation clear.8 Martians with superior technology invade, shocking the smug forces of British imperialism whose most advanced equipment is insignificant in the face of Martian weapons. The opening satirizes the complacent belief that British culture would always exceed any other it encounters: although humans “fancied there might be other men upon Mars, perhaps inferior to themselves and ready to welcome a missionary enterprise” they are wholly unprepared to contemplate “intellects vast and cool and unsympathetic” to human priorities.9 Detailing the violent consequences of the invasion for British people, Wells’s narrator calls upon readers to remember “what ruthless and utter destruction our own species has wrought,” not only on animals now extinct but also on colonized populations: “The Tasmanians, in spite of their human likeness, were entirely swept out of existence in a war of extermination waged by European immigrants in the space of fifty years.”10

殖民主义与科幻小说之间的构成关系既带来了问题，也带来了机遇。

The constitutive relationship between colonialism and sf creates both problems and opportunities.

“与人相似”这一短语当然强化了殖民等级制度；即便我们倾向于以更宽泛的方式解读它，将其解读为对殖民意识形态未能承认我们自身物种中不言而喻的成员的讽刺，它也强调了外星人作为被殖民者的寓言是多么隐晦。尤其是在通俗小说传统中，许多太空冒险故事将人类探索和占有“最后的边疆”（正如《星际迷航》中令人振奋的描述）的权利视为理所当然。11以斯坦利·温鲍姆的《火星奥德赛》（1934）为例，这部通俗小说是通俗小说时代的经典之作，在1970年科幻作家名人堂提名投票中，它仅次于艾萨克·阿西莫夫的《夜幕降临》（1941）。12这个故事因其展现科学观察和推断的力量而备受喜爱：火星上的地球太空探险家贾维斯与他的同伴失散了。在穿越火星的过程中，他遇到了形似鸟类的外星人特威尔，并与之发展了伙伴关系。特威尔和贾维斯在火星上遇到了各种各样的其他生物，它们象征着缺乏智慧、与动物相似的生物；相比之下，特威尔通过学习英语、理解天文图表和使用工具证明了他的“人性”。故事依赖于殖民等级制度，即只有当土著民族的文化符合西方现代性所认定的文明标准时，他们才被承认为完全的人类。清晰可见。此外，在结局中，特威尔和贾维斯与另一种外星生物展开战斗，这些生物形似桶状，只能死记硬背英语短语，其活动围绕着一个具有治愈能力的水晶物体展开。故事的结局描述了贾维斯和特威尔击败非人类对手的精彩战斗，只在最后一句——以玩笑的语气——承认冲突的起因是贾维斯偷走了这块水晶。毋庸置疑，他拥有这块水晶的所有权，因为他拥有的科学知识将使他能够更好地利用它。

The phrase “human likeness,” of course, reinforces colonial hierarchies; even if we are inclined to read it in a more generous way, as a satire of the failure of colonial ideology to acknowledge what are self-evidently members of our own species, it emphasizes how close to the surface lies the allegory of aliens as colonized others. In the pulp tradition especially, many tales of space adventure take for granted the right of humans to explore and appropriate, as Star Trek so exhilaratingly put it, “the final frontier.”11 Take, for example, Stanley Weinbaum’s “A Martian Odyssey” (1934), a celebrated story from the pulp era that was second only to “Nightfall” (1941) by Isaac Asimov in a poll of sf writers in 1970 nominating Hall of Fame stories.12 The story is beloved for its illustration of the power of scientific observation and extrapolation: an Earth space explorer on Mars, Jarvis, is separated from his companions. As he traverses the landscape he meets and develops a partnership with Tweel, a birdlike alien. Tweel and Jarvis encounter a variety of other creatures on Mars, who symbolize nonintelligent, animal-analogue beings; Tweel, in contrast, proves his “humanity” by being able to learn English, comprehend astronomical diagrams, and use tools. The story’s reliance on colonial hierarchies that recognize Indigenous peoples as fully human only if their cultures conform to criteria Western modernity deems civilized is clear. Moreover, in the conclusion Tweel and Jarvis fight with a different alien species, barrel-like creatures who can only repeat English phrases by rote and whose activity centers on a crystal object that has healing powers. The story’s denouement describes the exciting fight through which Jarvis and Tweel defeat their subhuman opponents, acknowledging only in the very last line—and in a joking tone—that the conflict was caused by Jarvis stealing this crystal. His unquestioned entitlement to it, as someone whose scientific knowledge will enable him to make better use of it, goes without saying.

许多早期科幻小说都体现了类似的态度，即认为科学成就的提升会直接转化为更有价值的文化和民族。默里·莱因斯特的《第一次接触》（1945）是另一个被提名入选早期名人堂的故事，它为第一次接触科幻小说设定了框架：相遇的物种难以跨越差异进行交流，而唯一合理的假设是，除非证明对方并非如此，否则对方就是敌人和威胁。莱因斯特笔下的人物找到了相互信任的方式，但殖民历史——技术水平截然不同的文明之间的接触最终会给其中一方带来灾难——始终萦绕在叙事中。格温妮丝·琼斯在其精彩的阿留申三部曲中讽刺了这种倾向，这部作品将第一次接触重新定义为人类学家与其研究对象之间的相遇，是……的结合。由于缺乏共同的世界观和故意误导而产生的误解。13沟通是存在的，但从来都不是直接的，也不会没有后果。当然，有些科幻作品将与其他物种的接触描绘成积极的，但我们也看到了殖民主义的等级逻辑：在诸如阿瑟·克拉克的《童年的终结》（1953 年）或道格拉斯·怀斯的经典电影《地球停转之日》（1951 年）等有影响力的故事中，外星人是仁慈的帝国种族，来这里是为了拯救人类免于被误导的冲动，并帮助我们达到他们优越文明的水平。

Much early sf reveals similar attitudes, the presumption that enhanced scientific achievement directly translates into worthier cultures and peoples. “First Contact” (1945) by Murray Leinster, another story nominated for this early Hall of Fame, creates the parameters for first contact sf: species meeting one another struggle to communicate across difference and the only reasonable hypothesis from which to proceed is that the other is an enemy and threat until proven otherwise. Leinster’s characters find a way to trust one another, but colonial history—in which contact between civilizations of starkly different technological capacity spells disaster for one of them—haunts the narrative. Gwyneth Jones satirizes this tendency in her brilliant Aleutian trilogy, which reinvents first contact as something more like the encounter between anthropologists and their subjects, a combination of misunderstanding due to the absence of a shared worldview and deliberate misdirection.13 Communication happens, but never straightforwardly or without consequence. Certainly, there are examples of sf that portray contact with other species as positive, but here too we see a colonialist logic of hierarchy: in influential stories such as Arthur C. Clarke’s Childhood’s End (1953) or Douglas Wise’s classic film The Day the Earth Stood Still (1951), aliens are the benevolent imperial race, here to save humanity from our misguided impulses and help us achieve the level of their superior civilization.

即使是SETI（搜寻地外文明计划），尤其是其主动版本——向宇宙发送信号而非仅仅监听外星生命迹象——也受到了殖民主义思维的影响。2015年，包括科幻作家大卫·布林和科学创新者埃隆·马斯克在内的一组研究人员签署了一份声明，称发送此类信息对地球构成了不必要的、人们知之甚少的风险，因此所有此类努力都应停止，直到全球“科学、政治和人道主义讨论”能够确定最佳行动方案。14他们担忧的原因包括外星文化的未知内涵，以及他们的技术可能优于我们，这在殖民者的眼光中无疑是一种风险。刘慈欣的《三体》（中文版2008年；英文版2014年）是首部获得雨果奖的中国小说。故事开篇是一位研究人员决定回应从外太空收到的外星信号，从而引发外星入侵；该三部曲的后两部分别探讨了如何抵抗入侵，以及当地球上的生存不再可行时，流离失所的人类文化如何生存下去。15因此，进入二十一世纪，科幻小说的殖民“质感”依然存在。

Even SETI (Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence) and especially the proactive version, Messaging to Extraterrestrial Intelligence (METI), which sends signals into the cosmos rather than just listen for signs of alien life, has been touched by colonial thinking. In 2015, a group of researchers, including sf author David Brin and science innovator Elon Musk, signed a statement that sending such messages posed an unwarranted and poorly understood risk to Earth, and thus all such efforts should be halted until a global “scientific, political and humanitarian discussion” could determine the best course of action.14 Among their reasons for concern are the unknown intensions of alien cultures and the likelihood that their technology will be superior to ours, axiomatically a risk in the colonial gaze. Liu Cixin’s The Three-Body Problem (Chinese 2008; English 2014), the first Chinese novel to win a Hugo Award, begins with a researcher who decides to answer an alien signal received from outer space, provoking the launch of an alien invading force; the next two books in this trilogy are devoted to the problem of how to resist this invasion, and how a displaced human culture survives when living on Earth is no longer viable.15 Thus, into the twenty-first century, the colonial “texture” of sf remains.

当然，该领域的许多作家都承认并抵制这种趋势，这种倾向在 20 世纪 60 和 70 年代的新浪潮科幻小说中尤为明显，该流派受到当时反主流文化和独立运动的强烈影响。新浪潮作家不仅推动更具风格实验性的科幻作品以完善该流派的美学品质，还谴责那些仅仅重复科幻黄金时代技术官僚幻想的作品与时俱进。例如，在已有太空计划的世界中，有关太空旅行和殖民的写作被认为是过时的，只是强化了既定的意识形态，而不是开辟关于世界和未来的创新思维。JG 巴拉德在《新世界》杂志上发表的一篇颇具影响力的评论中指出，“老派太空歌剧”已无法维持一种渴望成为“明日橱窗”的流派。16他呼吁这种体裁超越 20 世纪 30 年代的传统，通过关注内在空间而非外在空间来寻找“新的符号和语言”。17巴拉德和他的同时代人，尤其是迈克尔·穆尔科克，在将《新世界》杂志转型为新科幻先锋的过程中，它发挥了主导作用。该杂志汲取了当代视觉艺术实验的灵感，远离了物理学或工程学等“硬”科学，转向了心理学和人类学。当然，并非所有人都接受这些变化，新浪潮的兴起也引发了新的争论：科幻的价值究竟在于其与当代科学的严谨交锋，还是在于其重塑社会世界的超越性潜力。

Many writers within the field recognize and resist this tendency, of course, an orientation particularly apparent in New Wave sf of the 1960s and 1970s, which was strongly influenced by contemporary countercultural and independence movements. As well as pushing for more stylistically experimental sf that would refine the aesthetic qualities of the genre, New Wave writers also decried the irrelevance of works that simply reiterated technocratic fantasies associated with the Golden Age of sf. Writing about space travel and colonization, for example, was deemed passé in a world with an existing space program, simply reinforcing given ideology rather than opening up innovative thinking about the world and the future. In an influential editorial published in New Worlds, J. G. Ballard argues that “old-guard space opera” could no longer sustain a genre that aspired to be “the shop window of tomorrow.”16 He calls for the genre to move beyond conventions conceived in the 1930s, to find “fresh symbols and languages” through a focus on inner rather than outer space.17 Ballard and his contemporaries, especially Michael Moorcock, who took a lead role in transforming New Worlds magazine into a vanguard of the new sf that took its cues from contemporary experiments in the visual arts, turned away from “hard” sciences such as physics or engineering and toward psychology and anthropology. Not everyone embraced these changes, of course, and the emergence of the New Wave also inaugurated renewed debate about whether the value of sf was its rigorous engagement with contemporary science or its transgressive potential to reinvent the social world.

当代主流文学，尤其是后现代主义的元小说风格，经常探讨与科学及其产物（例如新药和娱乐媒体）如何改变二十世纪生活相关的主题。随着科幻小说也逐渐走向元小说化，威廉·巴勒斯、库尔特·冯内古特和托马斯·品钦等作家的作品受到了科幻界内外读者的追捧。巴里·马尔茨伯格的《星系》（ 1975）在首页就宣称“这与其说是一部小说，不如说是一系列通往小说的笔记”，并频频抨击坎贝尔仍然推崇的技术官僚风格所要求的想象力的狭隘性。18叙述者渴望“探讨这样一个主题：技术的扩张只会限制意识，制造出更强烈的疏离感、无能为力、绝望等等”，但却无法在通俗科幻小说的语言。19新浪潮主题集中体现了对技术社会危害性的质疑，这为质疑技术和科幻想象在殖民压迫中所扮演的角色开辟了空间。例如，穆尔科克的《杰瑞·科尼利厄斯》系列（1968-1977）讲述了一位同名特工的冒险经历，他改变了种族和性别认同。20该系列以越南和缅甸等地为背景，既讽刺了黄金时代的冒险科幻，也讽刺了当代英国政治，当时前殖民地经历了多次独立斗争，更不用说由于这些殖民地移民增加而导致的种族紧张局势，该系列运用熵的概念将大英帝国描绘成一个失去能量并因此趋于解体的封闭系统。

Contemporary mainstream literature, especially the metafictional style of postmodernism, often addressed themes related to how science and its products—for example, new drugs and entertainment media—were transforming twentieth-century life. Writers such as William Burroughs, Kurt Vonnegut, and Thomas Pynchon were claimed by readerships both within and beyond sf as the genre, too, became metafictional. Barry Malzberg’s Galaxies (1975) announces on its first page that “this will not be a novel so much as a series of notes toward one” and frequently rails against the narrowness of the imagination required for the technocratic style still championed by Campbell.18 The narrator aspires to “address the theme that the expansion of technology will only delimit consciousness, create greater feelings of alienation, impotence, hopelessness, and so on” but cannot do so in the language of pulp sf.19 The desire to ask questions about socially detrimental aspects of technology epitomizes New Wave themes, opening space to question the role of both technology and the sf imagination in colonial oppression. Moorcock’s Jerry Cornelius series (1968–1977), for example, follows the adventures of an eponymous secret agent, who changes race and gender identity.20 A biting satire of both Golden Age adventure sf and of contemporary British politics during multiple independence struggles by former colonies—not to mention racial tension over increased immigration from these colonies—this series is set in places such as Vietnam and Burma, and uses the idea of entropy to depict the British Empire as a closed system losing energy and thus tending toward dissolution.

托马斯·M·迪施（Thomas M. Disch）的《集中营》（Camp Concentration，1968）讲述了一位诗人因良心拒服兵役而入狱的故事。美国允许一家私人公司接触囚犯，并对他进行实验。他被注射了一种名为帕利定（Pallidine）的药物，旨在提高智力。这种药物源于梅毒，与长达四十年的塔斯基吉研究（Tuskegee Study）惊人地相似。该研究让非裔美国男性不接受治疗，以观察梅毒的长期影响，并通过为其他疾病提供免费医疗来吸引他们参与。迪施的故事最初于1967年在《新世界》（New Worlds）杂志上连载，而塔斯基吉研究直到1969年才被揭发者揭露。1972 年，但小说与历史现实之间的呼应表明，科学的意识形态背景及其与系统性歧视结构的历史共谋之间存在重叠，而这恰恰是新浪潮试图阐明的“无意识”或“内心世界”载体。厄休拉·勒古恩的《世界之词是森林》（1976 年）通过将殖民化描绘为殖民占领，更新了太空殖民叙事，并影射了美莱村大屠杀，当时美军杀害了手无寸铁的越南平民，包括儿童。在小说中，类似的事件引发了被奴役的外星人反抗拒绝承认他们是人的人类殖民者的独立斗争。这是勒古恩写的众多关于星际接触的书籍之一，这些书籍都关注跨越文化和物理差异谈判外交关系的困难，突出了通信技术而不是交通或战争技术。

Thomas M. Disch’s Camp Concentration (1968) is about a poet imprisoned for his conscientious objection to the US occupation of Vietnam, who is experimented upon by a private corporation to whom the United States has given access to prisoners. He is given a drug, Pallidine, intended to enhance intelligence. The drug is derived from syphilis, eerily similar to the forty-year-long Tuskegee Study, which left African American men untreated to observe the long-term effects of syphilis, gaining their participation by offering free health care for other conditions. Disch’s story was originally serialized in New Worlds in 1967, while the Tuskegee Study was revealed by whistle-blowers only in 1972, but the echoes between fiction and historical reality suggest an overlap of the ideological contexts of science and its historical complicity with structures of systemic discrimination, precisely the kinds of “unconscious” or “inner world” vectors the New Wave sought to illuminate. Ursula K. Le Guin’s The Word for World Is Forest (1976) updates space colonization narratives by depicting colonization as a colonial occupation, and she alludes to the My Lai massacre, when US forces killed unarmed Vietnamese civilians, including children. In the novel, a similar incident provokes an independence struggle by the enslaved alien population against human colonizers who refuse to recognize them as people. This is one of many books about interplanetary contact Le Guin wrote, all of which focus on the difficulties of negotiating diplomatic relations across cultural and physical differences, foregrounding technologies of communication rather than those of transportation or warfare.

与勒奎恩一样，詹姆斯·蒂普特里二世（爱丽丝·谢尔顿的笔名）也创作了一些作品，质疑早期科幻小说背后的殖民逻辑，引发了人们对性别歧视和种族歧视交织体系的关注。1977年，谢尔顿以男性名字命名的女作家身份在出版了十年作品后被曝光，引发了一场关于性别观念如何被编码到科幻故事和组织中的广泛讨论，但人们对性别问题关注较少。她的作品也探讨了对殖民主义态度的重要批判。蒂普特里的故事质疑人类文化，尤其是西方文化的优越性，这或许在她颇具影响力的《男人看不见的女人》（1973）中得到了最好的体现。这部作品讲述了两位女性宁愿跟随外星人类学家离开地球，也不愿继续被普遍存在的性别歧视所贬低的故事。女权主义的主题显而易见，但蒂普特里对主人公对玛雅飞行员表现出的种族主义和轻蔑态度的关注，丝毫不逊于对女性对他性别歧视的愤怒的关注。

Along with Le Guin, James Tiptree Jr. (the pseudonym of Alice Sheldon) wrote works that interrogate the colonial logics underpinning earlier sf, drawing attention to entwined systems of sexist and racialized discrimination. When Sheldon’s identity as the female author behind the male name was revealed in 1977 after a decade of publications, it prompted a widespread discussion regarding how ideas about gender were encoded into sf stories and organizations, but less attention has been paid to the important critique of colonial attitudes that her work also pursues. Tiptree’s stories question the presumed superiority of human cultures, much less Western ones, perhaps best captured in her influential “The Women Men Don’t See” (1973), about two women who prefer to leave the planet with alien anthropologists rather than continue to be diminished by pervasive sexism. The feminist motif is clear, but Tiptree is as attentive to the racist and dismissive attitude the central male character expresses toward their Mayan pilot as she is to the women’s exasperation with his sexism.

正如大卫·希金斯所指出的，这种对科幻想象中殖民幻想的批判固然有其价值，但它也使得仍然以白人为主的读者群在想象中将自己投射到那些维系白人特权的相同结构的受害者角色中。21乔治·卢卡斯的《星球大战》（1977）是这种逆转幻想的典型例子，其广受欢迎的魅力恰如其分地体现了科幻小说如何回应反主流文化中出现的价值观转变，在此之后，直接将自己认同为帝国征服的代理人已不再可行。詹姆斯·卡梅隆的《阿凡达》（2009）的强烈反响证明了这种幻想依然具有多么强大的力量。因此，尽管人们对殖民主义的态度已经发生了变化，但此类叙事仍然是科幻小说的基础。希金斯批评了仅仅将我们的身份从殖民者转变为被殖民者的局限性，这个问题象征着科幻小说传统上在种族表征方面一直存在困难。正如早期科幻小说源于对西方文化的预设认同一样，它也通常预设人类的默认肤色是白人，或者至少认为白人标志着一种“中性”的人类身份，所有种族，包括外星人和机器人，都渴望拥有这种身份。

As David Higgins points out, as valuable as this critique of colonial fantasy in the sf imagination might be, it also had the effect of letting the still largely white audience project itself imaginatively into the role of victim of the same structures that sustain white privilege.21 The vastly popular appeal of George Lucas’s Star Wars (1977), a quintessential example of this reversal fantasy, is an apt index of how sf responded to shifting values emerging from the counterculture, after which straightforward identification with agents of imperial conquest was no longer feasible. The intense embrace of James Cameron’s Avatar (2009) speaks to how powerful this fantasy remains. Thus, although attitudes toward colonialism have changed, such narratives remain foundational to sf. Higgins critiques the limitations of merely shifting our identification from the colonizers to the colonized, a problem that emblematizes the difficulty sf has traditionally had with representations of race. Just as early sf emerged from a presumed identification with Western culture, it also usually presumed a default whiteness for humanity, or at the very least assumed that whiteness marked a “neutral” human identity to which all peoples, including aliens and robots, aspired.

低俗小说和黄金时代科幻通常只是简单地描绘了一个只有白人存在的未来——这反映了当代主流媒体的刻画，却没有探究为什么未来没有有色人种——或者描绘了一个理想化的、超越了种族主义的、不分肤色的世界。到了新浪潮时期，勒奎恩的《天堂的车床》（1971）以诡辩的口吻驳斥了这种种族主义可以通过进步轻易消除的幻想；在这部作品中，愿望可以物质地改变世界，而对种族主义终结的渴望创造了一个每个人都是暗淡灰色的世界。其他当代作品将种族冲突投射到未来的种族战争中，例如克里斯托弗·普里斯特的《黑暗岛赋格曲》（1972）或威尔逊·塔克的《宁静太阳之年》（1970）。即使没有明确地探讨种族差异问题，科幻小说也常常强化一种以白人为中心、将其他种族非人化的文化逻辑：非裔美国人通常被认为无法使用科技；土著民族被想象为永远生活在十九世纪的背景下，而亚洲人被想象为精通技术但又非人地与技术融合。

Pulp and Golden Age sf often simply projected a future in which only white people existed—mirroring contemporary mainstream media and failing to ask why no people of color persist in the future—or else presented an idealized, colorblind world that had transcended racism. By the New Wave era, Le Guin’s The Lathe of Heaven (1971) casuistically rejects this fantasy that racism could easily be abolished by progress; in it, wishes can materially transform the world, and the desire for the end of racism produces a world in which everyone is dull gray. Other contemporary works projected racial strife into future race wars, such as Christopher Priest’s Fugue for a Darkening Island (1972) or Wilson Tucker’s The Year of the Quiet Sun (1970). Even when not explicitly addressing questions of racial difference, sf was too often instrumental in reinforcing a cultural logic that put white people at the center and dehumanized those of other races: African Americans are often presumed to be incapable of using technology; Indigenous peoples are imagined as forever living in a nineteenth-century context, and Asian people are imagined as technologically savvy yet also inhumanly fused with their technologies.

安德烈·卡林顿将这段历史描述为“科幻小说的白人性”，他用这个词来指“科幻作家队伍中白人的过多代表权以及科幻文本中白人经历的过多代表权”。22他认为，通过这种方式来阐述这一难题，不仅使我们认识到科幻史中少数群体声音的代表性不足，而且使我们认识到科幻小说常常未能将白人性视为一种“具有社会意义的种族身份”，23这种失败限制了一些科幻作品在处理族裔身份、系统性种族主义和殖民历史的持续后果等问题的严谨性。最近的学术研究发现了许多以前不被视为科幻传统一部分的有色人种作家的作品，这些作品体现了另一种思考科学、殖民主义和种族问题的方式。例如，活动家马丁·德拉尼（Martin Delany）的《布莱克或美国的小屋》（Blake, or the Huts of America，1859年；连载于1861-1862年）讲述了一场奴隶起义和建立独立国家的斗争，书中运用了丰富的天文学知识来探讨航海。丽莎·亚泽克（Lisa Yaszek）认为，非裔美国测量员、发明家和年鉴作者本杰明·班尼克（Benjamin Banneker）是早期非裔美国科学创新小说的灵感典范，正如托马斯·爱迪生在白人社区流传的廉价小说中激发了类似的传统一样。24

Andre Carrington describes this history as “the whiteness of science fiction,” a term he uses to connote both “the overrepresentation of White people among the ranks of SF authors and the overrepresentation of White people’s experiences within SF texts.”22 This way of framing the difficulty, he argues, enables us to recognize not only the underrepresentation of minority voices in much of sf’s history but also its frequent failure to interrogate whiteness as a “socially significant racial identity,”23 a failure that limits the rigor with which some sf has been able to address issues of ethnic identity, systemic racism, and the ongoing consequences of colonial history. Recent scholarship has recovered many works by writers of color that were not previously recognized as part of the sf tradition, which embody another way of thinking about science, colonialism, and race. For example, activist Martin Delany’s Blake, or the Huts of America (1859; serialized 1861–1862), about a slave revolt and struggle to establish an independent state, uses detailed knowledge of astronomy to discuss navigation. Lisa Yaszek argues that African American surveyor, inventor, and almanac author Benjamin Banneker is the inspirational model for early African American fiction about scientific innovation, just as Thomas Edison inspired a similar tradition in the dime novels circulating in white communities.24

在二十一世纪，科幻领域最突出且发展最为迅速的领域之一或许可以称之为后殖民科幻。它不仅涵盖非裔美国人、原住民、拉丁裔和亚裔作家创作的科幻作品，也包含那些明确驳斥殖民主义思维方式的作品，这些思维方式针对科幻类型及其所能讲述的故事。鉴于科幻类型在历史上根植于殖民文化的视角，将这些新的声音和视角引入其中必然会改变这一类型。在第一本后殖民科幻选集中，纳洛·霍普金森解释了为什么如此多的有色人种作家被这一类型所吸引，尽管它在处理种族和权力问题方面有着令人遗憾的记录。科幻小说讲述了被殖民者的经历，尽管并非常常以他们的声音呈现，霍普金森指出：“在我手中，主人的工具不会拆毁主人的房子——事实上，我更想做的不是摧毁它，而是进行大规模的翻修——它们为我建造了一座属于我自己的房子。”二十五

In the twenty-first century, one of the most prominent and growing areas of sf might be called postcolonial sf, which comprises not only sf written by African American, indigenous, Latinx, and Asian authors but also work that explicitly refutes colonial ways of thinking about the genre and the stories it can tell. Adding these new voices and perspectives to sf necessarily changes the genre, given how rooted it has been historically in the viewpoint of colonizing cultures. In the first anthology of postcolonial sf, Nalo Hopkinson explains why so many writers of color are drawn to the genre, despite its lamentable record when it comes to dealing with questions of race and power. Science fiction speaks about the experiences of colonized peoples, if not often in their voices, and Hopkinson points out, “In my hands, massa’s tools don’t dismantle massa’s house—and in fact, I don’t want to destroy it so much as I want to undertake massive renovations—they build me a house of my own.”25

正如后殖民科学研究促使人们认识到科学实践的多种方式，挑战了将非西方知识视为神话或迷信的殖民历史一样，26 21世纪的科幻小说也促使我们更广泛地思考什么才算“科幻小说”。NK·杰米辛著名的《破碎的地球》三部曲（2015-2017）的三部作品都探讨了气候变化以及生物差异如何导致种族化。这部作品旨在创造剥削性的等级制度，并荣获雨果奖最佳小说奖，这无疑表明，对坎贝尔式、民族中心主义的“硬”科幻的默认偏好已不再可行。正如此前围绕该类型未来的争论一样，这种偏好的转变也引发了少数人的怀旧情绪。27 Momentum显然倾向于改造该类型，使其更具多样性。

Just as postcolonial science studies compelled recognition of multiple ways of practicing science, challenging a colonial history that dismissed non-Western knowledge as myth or superstition,26 so too does twenty-first-century sf push us to think more capaciously about what “counts” as science fiction. All three books in N. K. Jemisin’s celebrated Broken Earth trilogy (2015–2017), about climate change and about how biological differences racialized to create exploitative hierarchies, won Hugo Awards for best novel, demonstrating without a doubt that a default preference for Campbellian, ethnocentric, “hard” sf can no longer be assumed. As in earlier conflicts over the genre’s future, such shifting preferences also provoked nostalgic backlash among a few.27 Momentum is clearly on the side of transforming the genre so that it contains greater diversity.

与殖民想象的关系仍然是塑造科幻的核心力量，但现在它的方向是从殖民者的角度讲述新故事，扩展被认可的科学范围，并越来越多地转向非印刷媒体，例如优先创作超媒体内容的非洲赛博朋克网站。28该领域发行点的多样化，例如引言中讨论的新出版社，是当今重塑科幻的最重要力量之一。最具创新性的科幻写作场所拒绝殖民历史和全球资本主义造成的新殖民主义不平等条件；这些场所包括来自非洲、拉丁美洲、印度、韩国、新加坡等地的科幻小说。全球科幻小说并不等同于后殖民科幻小说，但随着这一体裁变得更加全球化，它所回应的殖民历史也变得更加多样化，科幻小说叙述技术与全球化之间持续冲突的方式也更加多样化。

The relationship to the colonial imagination remains a central force shaping sf, but oriented now toward telling new stories from the point of view of those colonized, to expanding what is recognized as science, and increasingly toward nonprint media, such as the AfroCyberPunk website that prioritizes hypermedia content creation.28 This diversification of points of distribution in the field, such as the new presses discussed in the introduction, is one of the most important forces remaking sf today. The most innovative sites of sf writing reject colonial histories and the conditions of neocolonial inequality created by global capitalism; these include sf from Africa, Latin America, India, Korea, Singapore, and elsewhere. Global science fiction is not identical to postcolonial science fiction, but as the genre becomes more global the colonial histories it responds to also become more varied, as do the range of ways that sf narrates ongoing encounters between technology and globalization.

与殖民想象的关系仍然是塑造科幻小说的核心力量，但现在的方向是从殖民者的角度讲述新的故事。

The relationship to the colonial imagination remains a central force shaping sf, but oriented now toward telling new stories from the point of view of those colonized.

5

5

机器人、人工智能和超人类主义

Robots, AI, and Transhumanism

机器人是科幻小说中最为人熟知的标志之一，它曾一度成为科幻作品的标志。事实上，机器人一词源自卡雷尔·恰佩克的科幻剧《罗素姆万能机器人》。该剧于1921年首演，两年内被翻译成多种语言，并在欧洲多个城市演出。捷克语中“robota”一词原本用于描述被迫劳动的人，1923年在英文译本中变为“robot”，此后不久便用于描述科幻小说内外的人造生物。恰佩克的机器人是由生物材料制成的，但这个词很快在大众的想象中与机械自动机的古老形象融合。随着弗里茨·朗的电影《大都会》（1927年）的上映，以及影片中美丽的机械玛利亚的惊艳画面，公众的想象将机器人理解为一种金属生物，而这种理解又被艾莱克特罗（Elektro），威斯汀豪斯的机器人，曾在1939年世界博览会上表演。到20世纪40年代艾萨克·阿西莫夫开始发表他的机器人故事时，机器人已经完全成了科幻小说中的生物，一个科技奇迹，其根源在于非人化的、被剥削的劳动，这一点已被淡化。

The robot is among the most familiar icons of science fiction, once instantly marking a work as belonging to the genre. Indeed, the very word comes from a science fiction play, R.U.R., or, Rossum’s Universal Robots, by Karel Čapek. First performed in 1921, it was translated into multiple languages and performed in several European cities within two years. The Czech word robota, used to describe someone forced to labor, became “robot” in the English translation in 1923, used to describe artificial beings within and beyond sf shortly thereafter. Čapek’s robots were manufactured out of biological materials, but the term soon fused in the popular imagination with the older image of mechanical automata. With the release of Fritz Lang’s film Metropolis (1927) and its spectacular images of the beautiful mechanical Maria, the public imaginary understood the robot to be a metallic creature, reinforced by Elektro, Westinghouse’s mechanical man, who performed at the 1939 World’s Fair. By the time Isaac Asimov began to publish his robot stories in the 1940s, the robot was a thoroughly sf creature, a marvel of technology whose roots in dehumanized and exploited labor were muted.

科幻想象对机器人以及后来的人工智能概念的塑造程度无论怎样强调都不为过。正如詹妮弗·里在《机器人想象》中指出的，机器人研究人员经常以“描述早期与虚构机器人的接触”来开始他们的工作。1阿西莫夫的机器人三定律——(1) 机器人不得伤害人类，或因不作为而使人类受到伤害；(2) 机器人必须服从人类，除非违反第一定律；(3) 机器人必须保护自己，只要这样做不违反第一和第二定律——已经成为有关机器人设计以及我们与它们日益频繁互动的世界的伦理问题的讨论的起点。2虽然机器人曾是科幻小说的标志，但现在它们标志着技术在日常生活中的普遍存在。有一些人形机器人，比如汉森机器人公司的索菲亚，该公司网站上将其描述为“我们对人工智能未来梦想的化身”，还有本田的阿西莫，但在我们与机器人的大多数互动中，我们甚至可能没有意识到它们是这样的：Roomba 吸尘器、杂货店的自助结账站、自动取款机等。

It would be difficult to overstate the degree to which the sf imaginary has shaped notions of the robot, and later of artificial intelligence. As Jennifer Rhee notes in The Robotic Imaginary, robotics researchers frequently begin their work “with descriptions of early formative encounters with fictional robots.”1 Asimov’s Three Laws of Robotics—(1) that a robot may not injure a human or, through inaction, allow a human to come to harm; (2) that a robot must obey humans except in cases that violate the first law; and (3) that a robot must protect itself so long as doing so does not contravene the first and second laws—have become a starting point for conversations about robotic design and the ethics of a world in which we increasingly interact with them.2 While robots were once the assured sign of sf, they now mark the ubiquity of technology in daily life. There are humanoid robots, such as Hanson Robotics’ Sophia, described on the company’s website as the “personification of our dreams for the future of AI,” and Honda’s ASIMO, but in the majority of our interactions with robots we may not even recognize them as such: the Roomba vacuum, self-checkout stations in grocery stores, ATMs, etc.

很难夸大科幻想象对机器人概念以及后来的人工智能概念的影响程度。

It would be difficult to overstate the degree to which the sf imaginary has shaped notions of the robot, and later of artificial intelligence.

《理性与现实》（RUR）讲述了机器人对贫困生存的反抗，它们渴望超越罗森公司（Rossum Corporation）希望租给客户的劳动力身份，寻求新的生活，我们理应同情这些被剥削的机器人。其他早期机器人故事也保留了这种基调，例如莱斯特·德尔·雷（Lester del Rey）的《海伦·奥洛伊》（Helen O'Loy，1938），讲述了两个男人制造了一个拥有情感的家用机器人，并最终与其中一个结婚的故事；又如C.L.摩尔（C. L. Moore）的《无女人诞生》（No Woman Born，1944），讲述了一位戏剧女演员在自己的大脑被火烧伤后，被移植到金属身体里的故事。然而，这两个故事都揭示了机器人与仆人的混杂，这也体现了父权制家庭观念。阿西莫夫的故事通常关注机器人设计中的问题，有时也会展现僵化的机器人思维与人类社会生活多变轮廓之间的幽默交织，例如《理性》（Reason，1941）和《骗子！》（Liar!，1941）。 《迷失的小机器人》（1947）将三大定律视为一种道德要求而非实用要求：它讲述的是寻找一个第一定律被修改的失踪机器人，并最终揭示了这个机器人因被迫为能力较弱的人类服务而产生的怨恨。

R.U.R. is about the robots’ rebellion against their impoverished existence, their desire for a life beyond being the labor-power the Rossum Corporation wishes to lease to its clients, and our sympathies are meant to be with the exploited robots. Other early robot stories retain this attitude, such as “Helen O’Loy” (1938), by Lester del Rey, about two men who build a household robot that develops emotions and eventually marries one; or “No Woman Born” (1944), by C. L. Moore, about a theater actress whose brain is transferred to a metal body after her own burns in a fire. Yet both stories betray a conflation of robot with servant that also characterizes patriarchal ideas about domesticity. Asimov’s stories often focus on problems with robotic design and sometimes feature humorous encounters in which inflexible robotic thinking intersects with the fluid contours of human social life, such as “Reason” (1941) or “Liar!” (1941). “Little Lost Robot” (1947) interrogates the three laws as an ethical rather than pragmatic requirement: it is about the search for a missing robot whose first law has been altered and ultimately reveals this robot’s resentment at being forced to serve less capable humans.

20 世纪 50 年代最具影响力的作家之一菲利普·迪克创作了许多机器人（他更喜欢用“仿生人”这个词）与人类发生冲突的故事，其中包括《第二种类》（1953 年），该书讲述了人形人工智能武器如何诱骗人类与机器人交朋友的故事。其中包括《冒名顶替者》（1953 年）和《自动工厂》（1955 年），前者讲述的是一个没有意识到自己本体的武器化机器人，后者讲述的是一个自动化工厂，旨在为世界末日后的人类幸存者提供物资，尽管有多个迹象表明恢复的人类希望将生产交还给人类，但工厂仍拒绝停止生产。3迪克最著名的小说是《仿生人会梦见电子羊吗？》（1968 年），该小说被改编为雷德利·斯科特颇具影响力的电影《银翼杀手》（1982 年），讲述了一个未来世界，机器人工人（电影中的复制人）反抗奴役，并被赏金猎人“退休”（杀死）。在这部电影和他的其他几部作品中，迪克思考如何将人类与机器人模拟区分开来，并使用机器人角色探索在工业化、非人性化且往往自动化的世界中同理心的丧失。库尔特·冯内古特的《自动钢琴》 （1952）也展现了类似的自动化非人性化主题。影片中邪恶的经济协调计算机EPICAC（也是一种催吐药的名称）讽刺了IBM的ENIAC。让-吕克·戈达尔的先锋电影《阿尔法城》（1965）展现了由Alpha 60超级计算机运行的噩梦般阴森的现代城市，也表达了类似的主题。

One of the most influential writers of the 1950s, Philip K. Dick, produced a number of stories in which robots (or androids, his preferred term) come into conflict with humanity, including “Second Variety” (1953), about humanoid AI weapons that trick humans into befriending them; “The Imposter” (1953), about a weaponized robot unaware of his own ontology; and “Autofac” (1955), about an automated factory, designed to supply human survivors of an apocalypse, that refuses to cease manufacture despite multiple cues that recovered humanity wishes to return production to human hands.3 Dick is best known for his novel Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? (1968), adapted into Ridley Scott’s influential film Blade Runner (1982), about a future in which robotic workers, replicants in the film, rebel against their enslavement and are “retired” (killed) by a bounty hunter. In this and several other of his works, Dick considers how to differentiate humans from robotic simulacra, using android characters to explore the loss of empathy in an industrialized, impersonal and often automated world. Similar themes about the dehumanizing effects of automation can be found in Kurt Vonnegut’s Player Piano (1952), whose sinister economy-coordinating computer EPICAC (also the name for a medicine that induces vomiting) satirizes IBM’s ENIAC. Jean-Luc Goddard’s avant-garde film Alphaville (1965), with its nightmarish, bleakly modern city run by the Alpha 60 supercomputer, expresses similar themes.

正如 Despina Kakoudaki 和 Jennifer Rhee 所言，人们对机器人的普遍想象，被这种将人工智能与非人性化、往往是种族化的劳动相混淆的主题所困扰，这一主题也塑造了该领域的研究。Kakoudaki 创造了“金属脸”一词，用来描述机器人面部毫无特征的表面如何形成一片空白，投射出对差异的焦虑，这种焦虑通常与种族有关，而且往往特别与反黑人主义有关。4 Rhee 的书指出，人们认为机器人最擅长重复性、缺乏想象力和非智力任务，这种假设强化了那些被认为容易被机器人取代的人的边缘化，比如斯蒂芬福德的家庭主妇，这参考了艾拉·莱文的小说《斯蒂芬福德的妻子》 （1972 年），该小说讲述了一个精英社区的男人用更卑微的机器人取代他们的妻子，1975 年布莱恩·福布斯将该故事改编成电影。在《技术东方主义》（1995 年）中，大卫·莫利和凯文·罗宾斯创造了“技术东方主义”一词来描述当代流行文化，通过这种文化，人们对日本经济在新技术制造方面胜过美国的优势感到担忧，这种担忧被投射到日本人的刻板印象上，即日本人“冷漠、不近人情、像机器一样”，与他们的机器一样。5科幻小说中的机器人故事经常强化和延续这种刻板印象，通过回忆这个词起源于一部关于被剥削工人的戏剧，我们可以揭开非人化、种族化劳动的埋藏历史。

As both Despina Kakoudaki and Jennifer Rhee argue, the popular imagination about robotics is haunted by this thematic conflation of artificial beings with dehumanized, often racialized labor, a motif that has also shaped research in the field. Kakoudaki coins the term “metalface” to describe how the featureless surfaces of robot faces create a blank screen onto which are projected anxieties about difference, generally linked to race and often specifically to anti-Blackness.4 Rhee’s book notes how the presumption that robots are best at repetitive, unimaginative, and non-intellectual tasks reinforces the marginalization of those imagined to be easily replaced by robots, such as the housewives of Stepford, a reference Ira Levin’s novel, The Stepford Wives (1972), about an elite community of men who replace their wives with more servile robots, made into a film by Brian Forbes in 1975. In “Techno-Orientalism” (1995), David Morley and Kevin Robins coin the term techno-orientalism to describe a contemporary popular culture through which fears about the Japanese economy’s predominance over American manufacture of new technologies was projected onto a stereotype of Japanese people as “cold, impersonal, and machine-like,” equivalent to their machines.5 Science fiction tales of robots often reinforce and perpetuate such stereotypes, and by recalling that the word originated in a play about exploited workers we can uncover a buried history of dehumanized, racialized labor.

当大型计算机以及后来的联网设备等系统变得越来越普遍时，人们关注的主题越来越多地转向人工智能，无论其是否以人形形式体现。关于诸如 EPICAC 或 Alpha 60 之类的非人性化和专制系统的故事预示了类似的文本，并在《2001：太空漫游》（斯坦利·库布里克导演，1968 年）中以阴险的口吻将 HAL 奉为经典。HAL 是一个能够航行于太空的人工智能，他背叛了他的船员，必须被摧毁。影片中段探讨了人类与机器的对抗，并提出了以下问题：HAL 是否有权保护自己免受人类的侵害，以及无情逻辑的机器与不那么单方面的人类价值观之间可能存在什么根本性的不相容性。HAL 声称将任务置于船员之上，这一主题在《异形》（雷德利·斯科特导演，1979 年）中反复出现，其飞船的人工智能 Mother（或 MU/TH/UR 6000）为了保护公司的宝贵财产而将船员置于危险之中。不管环境如何，僵化的机器只会执行程序，这反映出当代文化对反主流文化的价值观越来越不感兴趣，而转向新自由主义：这些机器包括《恶魔种子》（唐纳德·卡梅尔导演，1977 年）中试图以肉身体现自己的人工智能系统 Proteus；《战争游戏》 （约翰·巴德汉姆导演，1983 年）中几乎引发全球热核战争的系统； 《西部世界》（迈克尔·克莱顿导演，1973 年）中出现故障的枪手；以及《终结者》（詹姆斯·卡梅隆导演，1984 年）中肩负使命的无情杀人机器模型。

When systems such as mainframe computers and, later, networked devices became more common, thematic concern turned increasingly to artificial intelligence, whether embodied in humanoid form or not. Concerns about impersonal and autocratic systems such as EPICAC or Alpha 60 anticipate such texts, canonized in the sinister voice of HAL from 2001: A Space Odyssey (Stanley Kubrick, dir.; 1968), the space-faring AI who turns on his crew and has to be destroyed. The film’s middle segment about humanity versus machines asks questions about whether HAL has a right to defend himself from human aggression and what might be a fundamental incompatibility between relentlessly logical machines and less unilateral human values. HAL claims to be prioritizing the mission over the crew, a motif that repeats in Alien (Ridley Scott, dir.; 1979), whose ship’s AI, Mother (or MU/TH/UR 6000), puts the crew at risk to secure valuable property for the corporation. Rigid machines who follow their programming regardless of context offer commentary on a contemporary culture increasingly less interested in the values of the counterculture and turning toward those of neoliberalism: these include Proteus, an AI system seeking to embody itself in flesh in Demon Seed (Donald Cammell, dir.; 1977); the system that almost starts a global thermonuclear war in Wargames (John Badham, dir.; 1983); the malfunctioning gunslinger in Westworld (Michael Crichton, dir.; 1973); and a model for the relentless killing machine with a mission in The Terminator (James Cameron, dir.; 1984).

性感机器人也强化了性别刻板印象，暗示了其他被剥削劳动力的历史和随着信息经济的发展，人工智能的形象也开始转向非实体化。不妨看看最近的电影《机械姬》（Alex Garland 执导，2014），它讲述了一个通过收集社交媒体数据而创造出来的人工智能艾娃（Ava）。正如早期科幻小说用机械自动化和情感消退的故事来回应工业化和商业化的问题一样，《机械姬》回应了这样一种语境：人类与机器融合的方式并非抹去情感，而是将其转化为数据点、可能被利用来盈利的信息以及模糊真实情感与模拟情感界限的社交表现。因此，这部电影更新了机器人创造的故事，探讨了机器人系统如何融入人类文化，回应了诸如 Siri、Alexa 或 Google Home 等试图预测我们提供服务需求的技术，掩盖了它们也在为其母公司生成有关我们及其消费选择的数据这一事实。程序员 Caleb 对 Ava 进行了图灵测试的修改版本，该测试询问的不是 Caleb 是否能识别她是人工智能（测试的最初目的），而是她是否能充分读懂他的情绪，从而操纵他帮助她逃跑。

The sexualized robot also reinforces gendered stereotypes, hinting at other histories of exploited labor and moving into images of disembodied AIs with the information economy. Consider the recent film Ex Machina (Alex Garland, dir.; 2014), about an artificial being, Ava, created by harvesting data from social media. Just as an earlier generation of sf responded to the problems of industrialization and commercialization with tales about mechanized automation and the waning of emotion, Ex Machina responds to a context in which humans have fused with our machines in ways that do not erase emotions but make them into data points, information that might be profitably leveraged, performances of sociality that blur the line between real and simulated affect. The film thus updates the story of robot creation to address how robotic systems are integrated into human culture, responding to technologies such as Siri or Alexa or Google Home that seek to anticipate our need to provide services, obscuring the fact that they are also generating data about us and our consumer choices for their parent corporations. A modified version of a Turing test performed on Ava by programmer Caleb asks not whether Caleb can identity her as an AI (the test’s original purpose) but whether she can read his emotions sufficiently well to manipulate him into helping her escape.

许多影评人对《机械姬》对种族和性别的刻画提出了质疑，但我们也可以解读这部电影，它揭示了种族和性别假设如何影响机器人和人工智能的历史。研究。当人工智能主要被设想为军事应用和可能夺取人类控制权的指挥系统时，它被拟人化为男性。在物联网中嵌入的人工智能的较新迭代中，除了满足我们的需求外，人工智能会逐渐淡出背景，它被拟人化为女性，这一点在电影《她》（斯派克·琼斯导演；2013）中也得到了体现。因此，尽管艾娃的性别与我们之前见过的许多性感机器人（从《大都会》中的玛丽亚到重启版《太空堡垒卡拉狄加》（2004-2009）中性感的赛昂人）一致，但也体现了机器人劳动力的女性化，因为它从事的是情感和服务型工作，而不是体力劳动。这部电影将人们的注意力引向塑造这些设计选择的想象，阐明了谁参与技术设计决策的重要性。6

Many critics have taken issue with Ex Machina for its representations of both race and gender, but we can also read the film as illuminating the history of how assumptions about race and gender have informed robotics and AI research. When AI was imagined mainly in terms of military applications and command systems that might seize control from humans, it was personified as masculine. In the more recent iteration of AI embedded in the Internet of Things, AI that fades into the background other than when serving our needs, it is personified as female, a point also made by the film Her (Spike Jonze, dir.; 2013). Ava’s gender, then, although consistent with a number of sexy robots we have seen before—from Maria in Metropolis to the slinky Cylons on the rebooted Battlestar Galactica (2004–2009)—also speaks to the feminization of robotic labor as it performs affective and service-oriented jobs instead of physical labor. The film draws attention to the imaginary that shapes these design choices, demonstrating why it matters who is involved in decisions about technology design.6

同样，白人艾娃（Ava）最终逃脱了囚禁，而亚裔京子（Kyoko）起初看起来像一个受虐待的佣人，后来才发现她是一个更早的、没有声音的人工智能，两者之间的对比或许可以被解读为对有色人种女性长期遭受双重边缘化的历史的延续——但也可以解读为对这段历史的批判。近期的电视剧，例如《人类》（2015年至今）和《西部世界》（2016年至今），将我们的同情心牢牢地指向了人工智能，并将有色人种角色作为人工智能扮演关键角色，更清晰地将这段历史带入了这项任务要求我们认识到人造实体是种族边缘人群的化身。保罗·巴奇加卢皮的小说《发条女孩》（2009）同样对全球化、生物工程以及科技创造的新生命如何被困于既定的全球歧视结构中提出了更为复杂的思考。这段富有想象力的历史意义重大，因为科幻小说中的理想化概念影响着技术的设计方式，既包括人们想象中的技术能够做什么，也包括它们如何融入先于它们出现的社会世界。就机器人和人工智能而言，关于种族和性别的假设可以被植入机器代码中，而其设计者甚至没有意识到这些问题，直到它们以令人痛心的方式显现出来，例如面部识别软件无法识别有色人种，或者用于评估简历的人工智能工具会自动降低女性提交的申请的分数。7

Similarly, the contrast between the Caucasian Ava, who ultimately escapes her imprisonment, and the Asian Kyoko, a character who at first seems to be a maltreated domestic servant and is only later revealed to be an earlier, voiceless AI, might be read as simply perpetuating a long history in which women of color were doubly marginalized—but it could also be read as a critique of this history. Recent television series such as Humans (2015–) and Westworld (2016–), which orient our sympathies firmly with the artificial beings and cast characters of color in key roles as AIs, more clearly take this history to task and require us to recognize artificial entities as figurations of racially marginalized people. Paolo Bacigalupi’s novel The Windup Girl (2009) similarly offers a more complex meditation upon globalization, bioengineering, and how new beings created by technology are caught within established structures of global discrimination. This imaginative history is important because idealizations drawn from sf inform how technology is designed, in terms of both what technologies are imagined as capable of doing and how they fit within a social world that precedes them. In the case of robotics and AI, assumptions about race and gender can be built into the code of machines without their designers even realizing the problems, until they manifest in distressing ways such as facial recognition software that fails to see people of color, or an AI tool to assess résumés that automatically downgrades applications submitted by women.7

设计选择相当于科幻界所谓的“世界构建”在现实世界中的对应物，即基于既有的文化假设共同创造社会及其技术，这些假设构成了一系列塑造未来可能性的约束条件：工作和家庭结构如何相互交织，哪些人被认为有价值以及原因何在，哪些事情容易实现，哪些事情难以实现，等等。在上述例子中，人工智能判断的局限性与其学习数据集的局限性有关，这确保了任何数据集中的系统性偏见会被人工智能复制。科幻叙事聚焦于新技术背景下的社会问题，是质疑和反驳此类未经检验的假设的长期影响的理想工具。这也是有色人种作家的增长和科幻创作国家扩张如此重要的原因之一。我们讲述的故事和我们设想的景象具有影响力，而多元化的声音对于提出新的问题至关重要。机器人技术和人工智能是科幻想象力与物质实践之间广泛交流的场所，这促成了共同的语言，以及通常共同的期望和信念。例如， “赛博空间”一词最初源自威廉·吉布森的小说，而尼尔·斯蒂芬森的“元宇宙”概念——一个虚拟人物在3D数字空间中互动的在线空间——启发并塑造了数字环境领域的研究，其中最著名的是“第二人生”的推出。8

Design choices are the real-world equivalent of what the sf community calls worldbuilding, that is, the coproduction of the social and its technology from existing cultural assumptions that create a set of constraints that shape future possibilities: how work and family structures intersect, what kinds of people are considered valuable and why, what is made easy and what is difficult to achieve, and the like. In the examples above, the limitations of the AIs’ judgment had to do with limitations in the datasets they were given from which to learn, ensuring that any systemic biases in the dataset would be reproduced by the AI. Focusing on social issues that are the context for new technologies, sf narratives are ideal tools for questioning and countering the long-term effects of such unexamined assumptions. This is among the reasons why the growth of writers of color and the expansion of nations producing sf are such crucial developments. The stories we tell and the spectacles we envision are influential, and diversifying voices is integral to asking new questions. Robotics and AI are sites where extensive exchanges between the sf imagination and material practice have resulted in a shared language and often shared expectations and beliefs. The term cyberspace, for example, originally came from William Gibson’s fiction, while Neal Stephenson’s concept of the metaverse—an online space where avatars interact in 3D digital space—inspired and shaped research in digital environments, most famously the launch of Second Life.8

设计选择相当于科幻界所称的现实世界的世界构建。

Design choices are the real-world equivalent of what the sf community calls worldbuilding.

赛博朋克小说是20世纪80年代兴起的一个广受欢迎的子流派，其主题聚焦于计算机和数字环境。回顾起来，它显然标志着科幻主题和意象在科幻爱好者以外的文化中得到更广泛接受的开端。赛博朋克深受新浪潮的影响，但与超现实主义的意识改变药物的遭遇相比，它对新数字技术私有化的媒体景观更感兴趣，并将科幻想象转移到一个新的内在空间。在控制台屏幕后面。吉布森在他开创性的小说《神经漫游者》（1984 年）中解释说，这种数据“矩阵”的“根源在于原始的街机游戏……早期的图形程序和军事上的颅脑千斤顶实验。” 9我们现在可以从相反的角度来谈论这个链条，在这个世界里，企业主导、身体改造和赛博朋克发明的沉浸式娱乐的加速数字化未来已经成为我们信息时代技术的想象基础：利润丰厚的电子游戏产业，尤其是大型多人在线游戏；融合网络和现实生活的社交媒体应用程序；以及军事技术，尤其是遥控无人机。

Cyberpunk fiction, a widely popular subgenre that emerged in the 1980s and focused on computers and digital environments, in retrospect clearly marks the beginning of a more pervasive embrace of sf themes and imagery in cultures beyond fandom. Deeply influenced by the New Wave, but more interested in the privatized mediascapes of new digital technology than in surrealist encounters with consciousness-altering pharmaceuticals, cyberpunk shifted the sf imaginary to a new inner space, behind the console screen. In his trailblazing novel Neuromancer (1984), Gibson explains that this “matrix” of data “has its roots in primitive arcade games . . . early graphics programs and military experimentation with cranial jacks.”9 We might now talk about this chain in reverse, a world in which the accelerated, digitized future of corporate dominance, bodily modification, and immersive entertainments invented by cyberpunk has become the imaginative foundation for the technologies of our information age: the lucrative videogames industry, especially massive multiplayer online games; social media apps that fuse online and physical lives; and military technologies, especially remotely piloted drones.

20世纪80年代，赛博朋克被认为是科幻界一种新的反叛态度的发源地，这种态度体现在DIY即兴创作和与反权威黑客相关的反文化价值观上，布鲁斯·斯特林在其小说集《镜影》（1986）的强有力引言中对此进行了宣扬。10这是文学界对信息时代的首次回应，标志着科幻成为学术研究的核心对象，其影响由拉里·麦卡弗里的《冲击现实工作室》（1991）所塑造。这部小说集收录了小说和散文，其前提是赛博朋克科幻与后现代主义文学之间的相似之处。弗雷德里克·詹姆逊的著名评论著作《后现代主义，或晚期资本主义的文化逻辑》（1991）至少在80年代末奠定了学术讨论的基调。虽然他没有广泛讨论赛博朋克，但他确实将其提名为“即使不是后现代主义的最高文学表达，也是晚期资本主义本身的最高文学表达” 。11赛博朋克是一种悲观主义文学，背景设定在未来，国家的重要性不如跨国公司，人类与机器在物理上融合，人们更倾向于网络存在的超越性，而不是身体的脆弱性。尽管一些评论家很快指出，这种对身体的贬低再现了笛卡尔二元论的种族和性别偏见，12 但这种对无限移动性的令人上瘾的想象对当时正在进行的机器人、人工智能和虚拟现实等思想产生了深远的影响，正如 N. Katherine Hayles 在《我们如何成为后人类》（1999 年）中仔细阐述的那样。13

During the 1980s, cyberpunk was putatively home to a new and rebellious attitude within sf of DIY improvisation and countercultural values associated with anti-authoritarian hacking, proselytized by Bruce Sterling in his forceful introduction to the fiction collection Mirrorshades (1986).10 This was literature’s first response to the information age and marked a moment at which sf became a central object of academic study, shaped by Larry McCaffery’s Storming the Reality Studio (1991), a collection of fiction and essays, premised on the parallels between cyberpunk sf and postmodernist literature. Fredric Jameson’s prominent critical work, Postmodernism, or the Cultural Logic of Late Capitalism (1991), set the tone of academic conversation at least to the end of the decade, and although he does not extensively discuss cyberpunk he does nominate it “the supreme literary expression if not of postmodernism, then of late capitalism itself.”11 Cyberpunk is a pessimistic literature, set in a future in which nations have become less significant than transnational corporations, where humans physically fuse with their machines and the transcendence of online existence is preferred to the vulnerability of the physical body. Although a number of critics were quick to point out that this denigration of the body reproduced racial and gender biases of Cartesian dualism,12 this addictive imaginary of unlimited mobility was deeply influential for ongoing ideas of robotics, AI, and virtual reality, as N. Katherine Hayles carefully charts in How We Became Posthuman (1999).13

赛博朋克的想象依然存在，尽管在其诞生不到十年，就出现了宣称“这场运动”已死的呼声。然而，即使许多纸媒作家试图超越他们所认为的衍生范式，赛博朋克在20世纪90年代仍然成为一种亚文化，受到被个人电脑重新定义世界的一代人的热烈欢迎。赛博朋克电影、电子游戏、音乐、角色扮演游戏，甚至时尚都在这一时期蓬勃发展，既体现在英美科幻小说中，也体现在日美动画和漫画中，其中许多以译本的形式在美国流传。未来由亚洲科技和企业主导的景象随处可见。沃卓斯基姐妹的赛博朋克的巨大成功电影《黑客帝国》（1999）及其续集和辅助文本，标志着赛博朋克如何成为一种超越科幻范畴的文化现象。随着Oculus Rift等虚拟现实头显以及沉浸感日益增强的电子游戏的普及，赛博朋克的想象影响力也与日俱增，并已成为网络文化的一种默认取向。吉布森以打字机创作了《神经漫游者》，并在沉浸式数据成为现实之前就构想了光彩夺目的世界，而他以及类似的愿景至今仍激励着我们。赛博朋克小说大多是男孩俱乐部——帕特·卡迪根的重要作品经常被引用作为其对立面——而男性气质也主导着游戏和其他网络文化，正如科林·米尔本在《重生》（2018）中所探讨的那样。14米尔本的作品追溯了网络文化——从“匿名者”等民主活动家到“玩家门”事件中的保守派评论员——在多大程度上利用科幻语言来表达抵抗和批评，以及为之奋斗和反对的未来。

The cyberpunk imaginary persists, although calls announcing that “the Movement” was dead emerged within a decade of its birth. Yet, even if many print authors sought to move beyond what they viewed as a derivative paradigm, cyberpunk became something of a subculture into the 1990s, eagerly embraced by a generation for whom personal computers were redefining the world. Cyberpunk film, videogames, music, role-playing games, and even fashion flourished during this period, both in Anglo sf and in Japanese anime and manga, much of which was circulating in the United States in translation. Images of a future dominated by Asian technologies and corporations were common. The huge success of the Wachowskis’ cyberpunk film The Matrix (1999) and its sequels and ancillary texts is one marker of how much cyberpunk became a cultural phenomenon well beyond sf. As technologies such as oculus rift and other VR headsets, alongside increasingly immersive video games, continue to grow in popularity, the cyberpunk imaginary has only grown in influence, and has become something of a default orientation toward online cultures. Gibson famously composed Neuromancer on a typewriter and imagined the glittering world of immersive data long before it was a material possibility, and yet his and similar visions continue to inspire. Cyberpunk fiction was mostly a boy’s club—Pat Cadigan’s important work is frequently cited as a counterpoint—and a masculine ethos also dominates gaming and other online cultures, as Colin Milburn explores in Respawn (2018).14 Milburn’s work traces the degree to which online cultures—from democratic activists such as Anonymous to the conservative pundits of the Gamergate fiasco—draw on the language of sf to articulate resistance and critique, futures to fight both for and against.

赛博朋克对人工智能和人机融合的愿景很大程度上缺少了如今盛行的分布式物联网，这些联网设备能够响应我们的声音、动作或其他提示，收集数据并使用算法来预测不久的将来，例如处理交通信息的导航设备，或根据数据进行自我调整的农业设备。土壤和水分。这些设备所宣扬的便利幻想——空了会重新订购订书钉的冰箱、Gmail 试图预测并预先回复你的电子邮件、追踪你健康状况的可穿戴设备——都被科幻小说所预见，尤其是黄金时代的科幻小说，它们描绘了一个能够满足人类需求的世界，即使它没有明确说明技术如何实现这种奢侈。仅举一个例子，雷·布拉德伯里经常被选入选集的小说《细雨将至》（1950）想象了一座未来的房子，它可以做饭、打扫、调节灯光、洗澡，甚至给孩子们读书。然而，故事的影响力并非来自于房子能够做到这些事情，而是来自于它在无人服务的情况下完成这些事情的讽刺意味：所有人都在核战争中丧生，就连一条路过的狗也会饿死在这片丰饶的土地上，因为这所房子没有设定让它进来。一些故事也预见了物联网等技术可能造成的社会孤立，比如 E.M. 福斯特的《机器停转》（1909 年），故事背景设定在未来人类生活在地下，所有需求都由一台预测机器满足，他们彼此之间唯一的联系也通过各种设备。福斯特的故事是对技术依赖的严厉警告，它描绘了一个没有目标的人类，被一台他们已经忘记自己制造的机器所奴役，当机器发生故障、人类文明终结时，他们完全无助。

Largely missing from cyberpunk’s vision of AIs and human-machine fusion is the distributed Internet of Things now prevalent, connected devices that respond to our voices, actions, or other cues, collecting data and using algorithms to anticipate the near future in examples such as navigation devices that process traffic information, or farming equipment that adjusts itself based on data about soil and moisture. The fantasy of convenience promoted by these devices—refrigerators that reorder staples when empty, Gmail’s attempts to anticipate and pre-answer your email, wearable devices that track your health—is anticipated by sf, especially sf of the Golden Age that projected a world responsive to human needs even if it did not specify precisely how technology might enable such luxury. To give only one example, Ray Bradbury’s frequently anthologized story “There Will Come Soft Rains” (1950) imagines a house in the future that cooks, cleans, adjusts lighting, runs a bath, even reads to the children. The story’s impact comes not from the house’s capacity to do these things, however, but from the irony that it does so in the absence of any humans to serve: they have all died in a nuclear war and even a passing dog starves among this cornucopia because the house is not programmed to let it in. Stories have also anticipated the social isolation that technologies analogous to the Internet of Things might cause, such as E. M. Forster’s “The Machine Stops” (1909), set in a future where humans live underground, all their needs met by a predictive machine, their only contact with one another mediated by devices. A stark warning against technological dependence, Forster’s story depicts a humanity without purpose, in thrall to a machine they have forgotten they made, utterly helpless when it malfunctions and their civilization ends.

近期的近未来科幻小说经常向我们展示我们如何被社交媒体机器控制，即使方式可能不尽相同。作家科里·多克托罗（Cory Doctorow）是这一领域的杰出人物，他发表了多篇关于这些工具的数据追踪和决策指导能力如何影响社会生活的文章。在《魔鬼出没的世界》（2017）中，他从大众汽车丑闻中推断，在该丑闻中，软件使该公司的汽车能够在测试条件下改变车辆的排放，从而使这些汽车获得符合在正常操作条件下并不符合的标准认证。15多克托罗将此描述为“你拥有的东西开始欺骗你”的情况，并认为物联网的广泛应用，即软件与其他软件对话并根据设定的参数做出选择，可能会“将平衡从人类转移到公司”。多克托罗明确指出，问题的根源在于这样的立法背景：允许企业通过编写报告误导性数据的设备来剥削客户，因此解决方案无法通过“更先进的计算机”找到。在这样的干预下，我们可以看到，那些描绘某些技术未来的虚构故事，在思考与其发布相关的政策决策时，能够发挥重要作用。

More recent, near-future sf often shows us how we are similarly controlled by our social media machines, even if not quite in the same way. Writer Cory Doctorow is prominent in this area, publishing a number of essays about how the data-tracking and decision-guiding capacities of these tools impact social life. In “Demon-Haunted World” (2017), he extrapolates from the Volkswagen scandal in which software enabled the corporation’s automobiles to change a vehicles’ emissions under conditions of testing, thereby allowing the cars to be certified as compliant with standards that were not so under normal operating conditions.15 Doctorow describes this as a situation in which “the things you own start to cheat you” and argues that the widespread adoption of the Internet of Things, software talking to other software and making choices based on set parameters, can “tilt the balance away from humans and toward corporations.” Doctorow is clear that the problems emerge from a legislative context that permits corporations to exploit their customers by coding devices that report misleading data, and thus solutions will not be found in “better computers.” In such interventions, we see how fictions that project the futures of certain technologies can play a significant role in thinking through policy decisions associated with their release.

刘宇昆的《绝配》（2012）完美地描绘了我们如何经常欢迎这种多克托罗诊断出一种操纵，轻信智能设备表面上的实用性。主人公赛的所有选择都由他的家用人工智能蒂莉引导，蒂莉反复提供“优惠券”，诱使赛从她选择的供应商那里购买商品，而不是引导他去他最初要求的商家或产品。与珍妮的偶遇促使赛与珍妮交往，而不是蒂莉推广的在线匹配。但他发现珍妮对蒂莉的母公司 Centillian 深感怀疑，该公司积极利用这位完美的助手收集用户数据，以便更好地通过消费主义来控制他们。珍妮甚至认为 Centillian 会干预选举结果——在俄罗斯机器人发布煽动性材料影响 2016 年美国大选的丑闻之后，这种可能性似乎不再那么渺茫——并招募赛参与一项旨在关闭这台机器的失败计划。与福斯特的故事不同，刘的故事以赛与通过蒂莉过滤的世界和解，接受持续监控作为继续享受按需便利的代价。

Ken Liu’s “The Perfect Match” (2012) offers a consummate portrait of how we often welcome precisely the kind of manipulation Doctorow diagnoses, taking the helpfulness of smart devices at face value. Protagonist Sai is guided in all his choices by his home AI Tilly, who repeatedly offers “coupons” to entice Sai to purchase things from vendors of her choice rather than direct him to the businesses or products he initially requests. A chance meeting with Jenny prompts Sai to socialize with her rather than the online matches Tilly promotes, but he learns that Jenny is deeply suspicious of Tilly’s parent corporation, Centillian, which aggressively uses this perfect assistant to gather data about her users, all the better to control them through consumerism. Jenny even believes Centillian interferes with election results—a possibility that seems less remote in the wake of scandals about Russian bots posting incendiary material to influence the 2016 US election—and recruits Sai in a failed plan to turn off this machine. Unlike Forster’s story, Liu’s concludes with Sai reconciled to the world filtered through Tilly, accepting continuous surveillance as the price of continuing to enjoy on-demand convenience.

奇点小说（singularity fiction）体现了科幻想象与21世纪日常生活的紧密融合，这是一个与赛博朋克密切相关的子流派。它的名字来源于科幻作家兼计算机科学家弗诺·文奇（Vernor Vinge）的论文《即将到来的技术奇点》（1993），该论文预测了计算机技术的加速发展，从而能够出现具有自我意识的计算机和/或计算机人类实体将实现超级智能。16这些新生命将能够实现现在难以想象的进步，将我们带入奇点，即“我们的模型必须被抛弃，新的现实规则得以确立的点”。奇点假说因雷·库兹韦尔而更加广泛地推广，它已经从科幻小说走进了智库。17尽管一些奇点观点担心我们将被视我们无关紧要的智能机器所取代，但大多数人认为这是人类的下一个阶段，是计划中的技术超越物质限制 — — 通常具体来说是死亡限制 — — 以及智力的增强，以至于科学技术将能够克服人类繁荣的任何障碍，开创一个难以想象的繁荣和舒适的时代。

A closely related fusion of the sf imaginary and daily life in the twenty-first century is embodied in singularity fiction, a subgenre closely related to cyberpunk. It takes its name from sf author and computer scientist Vernor Vinge’s essay “The Coming Technological Singularity” (1993), which anticipates the acceleration of computer technology such that self-aware computers and/or computer-human entities will achieve superintelligence.16 These new beings will be capable of now-inconceivable progress, launching us into the singularity that is “a point where our models must be discarded and a new reality rules.” Popularized more widely by Ray Kurzweil, the singularity hypothesis has migrated from science fiction to think tank.17 Although some visions of the singularity worry about the possibility that we will be replaced by intelligent machines who see us as irrelevant, most view this as the next stage of humanity, a planned technological transcendence of embodied limits—often, specifically, of mortality—and the augmentation of intelligence such that science and technology will be capable of overcoming any barrier to human flourishing, ushering in an era of unimaginable prosperity and comfort.

文奇阐述其理念后不久，一群自称“超人类主义者”（Extropians）的狂热分子倡导对未来的乐观展望，并积极追求人类化身的下一种模式，即与智能机器融合或改造身体。早期“超人类主义者”网站上流传着科幻文本的阅读清单，尽管这一运动越主流，对科幻的公开引用就越少。布鲁斯·斯特林在20世纪80年代创作的塑造者/机械论作品，尤其是《分裂矩阵》（Schismatrix，1985），象征着“超人类主义者”所想象的未来人类。到了21世纪初，“超人类主义者”（Extropian，意为表达熵的对立）这个名称被弃用。而倾向于使用“超人类”一词。18超人类主义继续制度化，主要由技术哲学家尼克·博斯特罗姆 (Nick Bostrom) 领导，他既借鉴了正在进行的增强智能和机器智能技术实验，也借鉴了预测和回应此类技术的科幻小说。19电影《超验骇客》 (Transcendence，沃利·菲斯特 (Wally Pfister) 导演；2014 年) 为当前关于这一主题的思考提供了入门知识，其略显混乱的结局显示了早期科幻想象与信徒相信超人类主义将会实现的更美好世界的承诺之间的紧张关系。从另一个角度来看，残疾人活动家挑战了这些话语中嵌入的关于增强或更高级人类形态的假设，批评一些研究举措抹杀了像他们这样的人。20赛博朋克框架之外的人机融合故事展示了科幻小说可以帮助我们以不同的方式思考能力、残疾和规范化体现的方式；安妮·麦卡弗里的小说《歌唱的船》（1969）就是一个例子，小说讲述了一个天生身体严重残疾但心智超群的年轻女子，她变成了一个“壳人”，她发育不良的身体被装在一个太空舱里，而她的心智与她控制的一艘星际飞船融为一体。

Shortly after Vinge articulated his ideas, a group of enthusiasts going by the name Extropians championed an optimistic vision of the future and the active pursuit of the next mode of human embodiment, either fusing with intelligent machines or transforming the body. Reading lists of sf texts circulated on early Extropian websites, although the more mainstream this movement became the less evident were overt references to sf. Bruce Sterling’s Shaper/Mechanist works of the 1980s, especially Schismatrix (1985), emblematize the future humans imagined by Extropians. By the mid-2000s, the name Extropian (coined to convey the opposition of entropy) was dropped in favor of the term transhuman.18 Transhumanism continued to institutionalize itself, led largely by philosopher of technology Nick Bostrom, drawing equally from ongoing technological experiments in augmented and machine intelligence and from sf that both anticipates and responds to such technologies.19 The film Transcendence (Wally Pfister, dir.; 2014) offers a primer in current thinking on this topic, and its somewhat confused conclusion shows the tension between an earlier sf imagination that taught us to fear sentient machines and the promises of a better world that adherents believe transhumanism will manifest. From another point of view, disability activists have challenged the presumptions about enhanced or superior human form embedded in these discourses, critiquing several research initiatives as erasures of people like them.20 Stories of human-machine integration outside the cyberpunk framework demonstrate the ways that sf can help us think differently about ability, disability, and normative embodiment; Anne McCaffery’s novel The Ship Who Sang (1969), about a young woman born with significant physical impairment but an exceptional mind, who becomes a “shell person,” her stunted body encased in a capsule as her mind is integrated with a starship she controls, is one example.

超人类主义如今已成为一项资金雄厚的哲学和研究运动，它强调其可行性，并回避其科幻根源，具体体现在以下中心：牛津大学人类未来研究所和非营利组织“Humanity+”。尽管这些机构的创办者与科幻界相去甚远，但它们却象征着科幻小说已成为21世纪的通俗文学：它长期以来探索的问题和构思的图像如今塑造着研究议程，并赋予了成千上万可能从未读过科幻小说的人的愿望以生命。

Transhumanism is now a well-funded philosophical and research movement that emphasizes its feasibility and eschews its sf roots, embodied in centers such as the Future of Humanity Institute at Oxford University and the nonprofit entity Humanity+. Adopted by people far removed from sf, such institutions nonetheless are emblems of how the genre has become something of a vernacular for the twenty-first century: the questions it has long explored and the images it conceived now shape research agendas and give form to the aspirations of thousands of people who may never have read a word of science fiction.

6

6

基因组学、微生物组和后人类主义

Genomics, the Microbiome, and Posthumanism
