A complicated actuarial practice calculates the financial costs to society of all crimes—property damage, but also loss of labor-power from murdered individuals, for example—and bills them to the perpetrators. Those unable to pay said fines are confined to a debtors’ prison, funded by corporate sponsors for whom they serve as an indentured labor force; meanwhile, wealth concentrates in fewer and fewer hands and jobs that pay a living wage vanish. £84,000 is the price the assassin pays for a contracted death that launches the novel’s revolutionary plot. Such a vision of the future without work offers a dystopian counterpoint to the utopian vision of accelerationism’s postwork future. Annalee Newitz’s Autonomous (2017), about a future in which patented pharmaceuticals sharply differentiate the quality and longevity of life available to the wealthy from that which is accessible to the poor, is another novel that features indentured labor, with people selling their lives in a contract rather than being employed for a wage. Sam J. Miller’s Blackfish City (2018), set in a floating Arctic city in a world devasted by climate change, features similar financial contracts, and the wealthy ensure their continued hegemony by fueling ethnic and religious dissent among the dispossessed.

这些小说与加速主义的乐观主义之间的对比，表明了将劳动自动化与一个将人类生活从对工资的依赖中解放出来的社会制度相结合的必要性。在这里，科幻小说、社会行动主义和思辨性设计都汇聚在保障基本收入制度的理想中，该制度可以提高劳动自动化程度，而不会让更多人陷入贫困。各种保障基本收入的方案已被活动家们倡导，也已被各国政府考虑，但迄今为止，尚未就其成本或收益达成共识。一种既不与经济状况调查挂钩，也不通过特定权利标准分配的公共支持系统（例如食品券项目、对有孩子的家庭的援助等）。亚利桑那州立大学的“未来时态”项目（第三章讨论）于2018年9月举办了一场关于全民基本收入的活动，该主题也作为主题出现在艾德里安·洪的《100件物品中的未来历史》（2013年）的多个章节中。这本书是未来学和科幻小说的有趣融合，通过描述一百种新技术，仿佛它们来自遥远的未来，而对于这些技术而言，它们只是过去的产物，从而让我们得以一窥未来的可能性。11洪氏的写作手法强调了技术与社会变革的交织程度。尽管基本最低收入并非他提出的“一百项创新”之一，但它在其十多个章节中反复出现：它既是公民在某些创新之后提出的要求，也是解决创新导致失业问题的解决方案，又或是一种可能性条件，它为重大突破提供了时间和创造力。同样，蒂姆·奥莱利的非虚构作品《WTF？未来是什么？为什么取决于我们》（2017）也预测了软件创新将带来的巨大财富，但也警告说，除非社会找到公平分享这些财富的方法，否则将导致颠覆性而非积极的社会变革。12

The contrast between these novels and accelerationism’s hopefulness points to the need to pair the automation of labor with a social system that frees human life from reliance on wages. Here sf, social activism, and speculative design all converge in the ideal of a guaranteed basic income system, which could enable increased automation of labor without casting more people into poverty. Various proposals for guaranteed basic income have been advocated by activists and contemplated by governments, but as yet there is no consensus on the costs or benefits of a system of public support that is neither tied to means testing nor distributed via specific criteria of entitlement (such as food stamp projects, aid to families with children, and the like). The Future Tense project at ASU (discussed chapter 3) held an event about universal basic income in September 2018, and the topic appears as a motif across a number of chapters in Adrian Hon’s A History of the Future in 100 Objects (2013), an intriguing blend of futurology and sf that provides glimpses into a possible future by describing one hundred new technologies as if from a further future for which they are artifacts of the past.11 Hon’s technique stresses the degree to which technological and social changes are entwined, and although basic minimum income is not one of his one hundred innovations, it recurs across more than a dozen of his chapters: as a demand citizens make in the wake of some innovations, as a solution to problems caused by unemployment due to innovation, or as the condition of possibility that enabled the time and creativity required for a major breakthrough. Similarly, Tim O’Reilly’s nonfictional WTF? What’s the Future and Why It’s Up to Us (2017) projects the great wealth that software innovation will bring but warns that, unless society finds a way to share this wealth equitably, disruptive rather than positive social change will be the result.12

小说开始描绘具有全民基本收入的世界，例如13 岁的詹姆斯·S·科里 (James S.A. Corey) 创作的广受欢迎的《苍穹浩瀚》系列 (2011) 改编为 SyFy 电视连续剧（2015-）。该剧大部分情节聚焦于政治冲突，但我们从背景中看到，基本收入支持是社会结构的一部分，尽管它与现有社会福利计划一样，常常被贴上同样的标签。休·豪伊的《世上没有算法》（2018）是《美国人民的未来》中的一篇短篇小说，它提供了一种类似加速主义的观点，即未来摆脱劳动和经济不稳定。故事以一个父亲是企业家的儿子的视角展开，通过人物之间的代沟，预示了人们对经济态度的根本转变。父亲将自己的经济成功归功于对市场的信任：他始终愿意根据大数据算法告诉他的某个地区需要什么来塑造自己的企业。他经常嘲笑那些在他看来是浪费的寄生虫，靠基本收入生活，而不是像他一样工作。故事发生在儿子陪他出差的时候，这是他们唯一能在一起的机会。最后，儿子透露，他和妻子都计划辞去工作，靠“基本收入”生活，以便有时间和精力抚养他们期待的孩子。他轻蔑地认为，父亲的职业道德缺乏爱和社群等人类价值观。由于算法管理的更高效的经济，两代人都获得了经济利益，但只有儿子接受了这些价值观。不以经济贡献为生活核心。

Fiction is beginning to imagine worlds that feature universal basic income, such as the hugely popular The Expanse series (2011), written by James S. A. Corey,13 adapted into a television series on SyFy (2015–). Most of the plot is focused on political conflicts, but we see in the background that basic income support is part of the social structure, although it is regarded with some of the same stigma often attached to existing social welfare programs. Hugh Howey’s “No Algorithm in the World” (2018), one of the stories in A People’s Future of the United States, offers something like the accelerationist view of a future freed from both labor and economic precarity. Told from the point of view of a son whose father is an entrepreneur, the story anticipates a radical shift in attitudes toward the economy by the generational gap between these characters. The father credits his economic success to his trust in the market: his willingness to always model his businesses on whatever big data algorithms tell him is needed for an area. He frequently derides those he sees as wastrel freeloaders, living off basic income rather than working as he does. The story is told while his son accompanies him on business errands, their only opportunity to spend time together. Eventually the son reveals that he and his wife both plan to quit their jobs and live on “basic [income]” so that they can devote time and energy to raising the child they expect, showing contempt for his father’s work ethic that he views as empty of human values such as love and community. Both generations experience economic benefits because of a more efficient economy managed by algorithms, but only the son embraces values not predicated on economic contributions being the core of life.

《奇怪的经济学》中的许多故事运用科幻小说的疏离手法，将当代经济体系中存在的种种问题引人关注，并运用熟悉的题材象征，帮助读者理解金融化经济中原本难以理解的抽象概念。弗雷泽·谢尔曼的《草总是更绿》探讨了财富和收入不平等的代际效应，他设想了一个这样的世界：拥有资本但命运坎坷的人，可以真正地购买那些资本匮乏但其他方面（例如家庭、朋友或职业幸福）富裕的人的命运。尼尔·詹姆斯·哈德森的《慢炸弹》寓言了我们如何为了利润而忽视气候变化的风险。小说设想一颗毁灭世界的炸弹在几十年内落下：书中的经济学家主人公被要求为政府撰写一份报告，证明通过吸走炸弹的部分能量来加快其下落速度是值得的，也就是说，缩短世界剩余的时间，以便通过这些被吸走的能量来提高当前的经济生产力。韦恩·库萨克的《枪炮还是黄油》改写了外星人入侵的故事，使其破坏不再源于外星力量的物理占领，而源于这些外星人向市场大量投放技术，导致当地产业消亡，人类被外星经济霸主奴役。K·M·麦肯齐的《消费》则呈现了一种沉浸式的虚拟世界体验，读取玩家的情绪来促进过度购物——在模拟中进行的所有购买都会记入真实账户并在游戏外以物质形式交付，尽管它们的物质形式并不像模拟中看起来那么奇妙。

Many of the stories in Strange Economics use the estrangement techniques of sf to draw attention to the problems of our contemporary economic system, using familiar genre icons to help readers conceptualize otherwise difficult to grasp abstractions of a financialized economy. Fraser Sherman’s “The Grass Is Always Greener” interrogates the generational effects of wealth and income inequality by imagining a world in which those with capital but poor fates can literally purchase the destiny of someone poor in capital but rich in other ways, such as family or friends or career happiness. Neil James Hudson’s “The Slow Bomb” allegorizes how we ignore the risks of climate change for the sake of profit. It imagines a world-destroying bomb falling over decades: its economist protagonist is asked to write a report for the government proving that it is worth increasing the bomb’s rate of fall by siphoning away some of its energy, that is, shortening the time left for the world, in order to enhance economic productivity in the present via this siphoned energy. Wayne Cusack’s “Guns or Butter” rewrites alien invasion so that the damage is caused not by physical occupation by alien forces but rather by these aliens flooding the market with technologies such that local industries die out and humans are enthralled to economic alien overlords. K. M. McKenzie’s “Consumption” presents an immersive virtual world experience that reads the emotions of its players to promote hyperactive shopping—all purchases made while in the simulation are billed to real accounts and materially delivered outside the game, although their material form is not quite as fantastic as they seemed in simulation.

许多以经济角度展望未来的科幻小说反复出现一些主题。对营利性医疗保健的担忧是一个普遍的主题，过剩劳动力是对经济的非生产性消耗，这种观点通常体现在批判这些人如何被非人化的故事中。一些热门电影也采用了类似的主题，例如米格尔·萨普什尼克（Miguel Sapochnik）的《回收人》（2010），这部讽刺作品讽刺了以利润为先的医疗保健行业造成的死亡。故事背景设定在一个昂贵的人工器官替代品以分期付款的方式购买的世界，如果付款逾期，它们就会被强行从活着的患者身上收回。14邓肯·琼斯（Duncan Jones）感人至深的电影《月球》（2009）描绘了在月球上开采新能源的未来。主人公萨姆在这项与世隔绝的工作中感到孤独，但他认为，与他最终返回地球后获得的薪水相比，这种牺牲是值得的。影片的视觉美感并非早期电影中常见的那种光鲜亮丽的太空时代设计，而是更能让人联想到其他能源开采中肮脏危险的条件。当萨姆最终意识到自己只是这个体系中一个可有可无的组成部分时，这种开采经济（能源开采、剩余价值开采）的残酷性便一览无余。克隆人，当他的劳动力（和生命）耗尽时，将被焚烧殆尽。他将被一群一模一样的萨姆取代，他们都在等待三年的服刑期，每个人都被自己是原始人类萨姆的幻觉所支撑。

A number of motifs recur across sf stories that project the future in economic terms. Concern about for-profit health care is a prevalent theme, as is the idea that an excess workforce is an unproductive drain on the economy, usually expressed in stories that critique how such people are thus dehumanized. Popular films have taken up similar themes, such as Miguel Sapochnik’s Repo Men (2010), a satire that lampoons the death caused by a health-care industry that prioritizes profit, set in a world in which expensive artificial organ replacements, purchased on installment, are violently repossessed from living patients if payments are late.14 Duncan Jones’s poignant film Moon (2009) envisions a future of mining a new energy source on the moon. The protagonist, Sam, is lonely in this isolating work but counts the sacrifice worth the salary he will eventually make upon his return to Earth. The visual aesthetic of the film is not the familiar sleek space-age design of earlier films, but more evocative of the dirty and dangerous conditions of other kinds of energy mining. The inhumanity of this economy of extraction (of energy, of surplus value) is made starkly visible when Sam eventually learns he is just another disposable part of this system, a clone who will be incinerated when his labor-power (and life) are used up. He will be replaced by a store of identical Sams, all waiting to serve their three years, each sustained by the illusion that he is the original, human Sam.

科幻、当代文化和金融之间最密切的联系或许在于支付系统的社会技术，尤其是比特币等加密货币的发明。比特币和其他数字货币提出了一个问题：是什么让货币“真实”，并将这种“真实性”与实体（例如黄金）和政府（作为货币合法性的依据）区分开来。比特币及其周边另类文化的兴起强化了我们可能将经济视为一种科幻，将货币视为一种社会技术，其影响远不止支付方式。从硬币和现金到借记卡和信用卡，再到通过手机进行电子支付，新的支付方式都改变了市场的社会关系，并且在整个二十世纪，银行机构往往处于中心地位。从援助机构和雇主那里接收资金通常需要银行账户，信用评级体系对人们日常生活和机遇的控制力日益增强，而随着实体店的关闭和大型仓库的激增，在线商务导致了就业条件的巨大转变。15这些变化引发了一场更广泛的讨论，即金融机构的准入对于公民包容的必要性，激励数字货币实验，进一步融合了科幻与物质性。这些讨论与20世纪90年代的科幻文化有着共同的根源，尤其是赛博朋克与网络解放组织密码朋克之间的高度重合。密码朋克认为加密货币是逃避政府对其金融交易监控的重要途径。尼尔·斯蒂芬森的《编码宝典》（1999）探讨了这种文化，讲述了一家IT初创企业开发其自身的国际加密货币的故事。关于加密货币未来将如何发展，政治观点分歧很大：比特币强调隐私和无需向金融机构支付费用，而其他货币，例如FairCoin，则寻求以平等和再分配为重点的方式重塑货币。16因此，那些尝试不同加密货币的人将其设计嵌入到对未来截然不同的愿景中，将货币定位为另一种可以创造多种结果的技术。

Perhaps the closest connection among sf, contemporary culture, and finance is in the social technologies of payment systems, especially the invention of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin. Bitcoin and other digital currencies raise the question of what makes a currency “real” and detach this “realness” from both physical entities (such as gold) and governments (as what legitimates a currency). The rise of Bitcoin and the alternative cultures that surround it reinforce the ways we might think of the economy as a kind of sf, and of money as a social technology shaping far more than methods of payment. New forms of payment, from coin and cash, to debit and credit cards, to electronic payments via mobile phones, have all shifted social relations of the market, and, throughout the twentieth century, have tended to put banking institutions at the center. A bank account is often required to receive funds from aid agencies and employers, the credit rating system increasingly has power over people’s daily lives and opportunities, and online commerce has resulted in a massive transformation of employment conditions as storefronts close and massive warehouses proliferate.15 Such changes inform a larger conversation about access to financial institutions as necessary for civic inclusion, inspiring experiments with digital currencies, further fusing sf and materiality. These discussions have common roots with sf cultures of the 1990s, especially the significant overlap between cyberpunk and the online liberation group cypherpunks, who see in cryptocurrency an important way to elude government surveillance of one’s financial transactions. Neal Stephenson’s Cryptonomicon (1999) explores this culture in its tale of an IT start-up that develops its own international cryptocurrency. Political opinion differs widely regarding how cryptocurrencies will unfold in the future: while Bitcoin emphasizes privacy and freedom from fees paid to financial institutions, others, such as FairCoin, seek to reinvent currency in ways that privilege equality and redistribution.16 Those experimenting with different cryptocurrencies thus embed their design within distinct and different visions of desirable futures, positioning currency as another technology that can create multiple outcomes.

比特币的兴起以及围绕它的另类文化强化了我们将经济视为一种科幻小说、将货币视为一种社会技术的想法。

The rise of Bitcoin and the alternative cultures that surround it reinforce the ways we might think of the economy as a kind of sf, and of money as a social technology.

正如经济学社会学家指出的，以及科幻小说开始探索的，加密货币最具革命性的潜在因素在于其底层的区块链架构。区块链技术催生了一系列新的点对点应用，例如Airbnb和Uber，这些应用有时被称为平台资本主义（或共享经济），并为思考其他以技术为中介的分布式企业和公民决策形式打开了大门。在对这些可能性的概述中，Wall街头记者保罗·维尼亚 (Paul Vigna) 和迈克尔·J·凯西 (Michael J. Casey) 设想的未来是“由多个股东拥有的实体，其日常财务决策——何时释放资金支付费用、支付多少股息——都由公司的指导软件自动执行，并委托给由区块链验证的防篡改系统。” 17

As sociologists of economics note, and as sf is beginning to explore, what is potentially most revolutionary about cryptocurrencies are their underlying blockchain architecture. Blockchain enables a wide range of new peer-to-peer applications such as Airbnb and Uber, sometimes referred to as platform capitalism (or the shared economy), and opens the door to thinking about other technologically mediated forms of distributed corporate and civic decision making. In their overview of such possibilities, Wall Street journalists Paul Vigna and Michael J. Casey imagine a future of “entities owned by multiple shareholders for which routine financial decisions—when to release funds to pay for expenses, how big a dividend to pay—are automated by the firm’s guiding software and entrusted to a tamperproof system that’s verified by the blockchain.”17

这种自动化治理令人联想起阿西莫夫的《基地》，但更像伊恩·M·班克斯在其《文化》系列（1987-2012）中描绘的后人类主义未来。该系列设定在一个遥远的未来，经济由人工智能规划，所有枯燥或危险的工作都由没有感知能力的机器完成。查尔斯·斯特罗斯的《渐行渐远》（2005）将这一愿景更进一步，设想了一种人工智能，它源于众多智能交易算法的交互。如同机器人技术或基因工程等技术一样，这种富有想象力的交换是双向的。正如斯特罗斯推断当前的人工智能交易将超越奇点一样，像卡梅隆·温克莱沃斯和泰勒·温克莱沃斯这样的风险投资家在描述他们的愿景时，也借鉴了科幻小说的意象：“贸易奇点将会出现，届时机器、计算机和物品之间的贸易将超过人与人之间的贸易。缺乏创造性的任务将主要实现自动化，从而导致商品和服务价格大幅下降，生活水平也将提高。” 18卡尔·施罗德的小说《偷窃世界》（2019）设想了一种区块链治理方案，结合人工智能，可以赋予非人类实体发言权，例如河流或特定动物物种是集体治理新愿景的一部分，该愿景优先考虑环境可持续性而不是资本主义利润。

This automated governance is reminiscent of Asimov’s Foundation but even more strongly resembles posthumanist futures projected in Iain M. Banks’s Culture series (1987–2012), set in a distant future where the economy is planned by AIs and all boring or dangerous work is done by nonsentient machines. Charles Stross’s Accelerando (2005) takes this vision a step further, imagining an AI that has emerged from the interactions of so many smart trading algorithms. As in the case of technologies such as robotics or genetic engineering, the imaginative exchanges work in both directions. Just as Stross extrapolates current AI trading beyond the singularity, venture capitalists such as Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss draw on sf imagery when they describe their vision that “a Trade Singularity will occur, whereby trade between machines, computers and things, will exceed trade between humans. Uncreative tasks will become primarily automated causing goods and services to become much cheaper and living standards to rise.”18 Karl Schroeder’s novel Stealing Worlds (2019) imagines a version of blockchain governance, combined with AI, that might give voice to nonhuman entities such as riverways or particular animal species as part of a new vision of collective governance that prioritizes environmental sustainability over capitalist profit.

在《海王星的子嗣》（2013）中，斯特罗斯直接探讨了债务问题，特别是债务如何转化为可交易的金融工具，从而引发了2008年金融危机。这部小说的灵感源自大卫·格雷伯的巨著《债务：最初的5000年》（2011），该书揭示了债务如何被用作政治控制的工具。19斯特罗斯的主人公是一位会计实务学者，在解开与失落的殖民地和被侵占资产相关的谜团的同时，她向读者介绍了未来的三种货币：快钱用于日常交易，类似于我们熟知的货币；中钱是一种固定资产，可以长期稳定地保值，这对于涉及星际旅行时间膨胀的文明至关重要；最后，慢钱是星际文明之间交易的货币，是一种通用货币，需要数十年甚至更长时间才能完成一笔交易。斯特罗斯设想的世界需要三种货币才能实现星际间的贸易。更大的主题在于，这些金融化的经济体总是以预期价值进行交易，如何将债务转化为可交易资产，从而加重未来经济的负担，使其不得不偿还当前消费产生的债务。

In Neptune’s Brood (2013), Stross directly takes on questions of debt, specifically debt as made into the type of tradable financial instruments that prompted the 2008 crash. This novel was inspired by reading David Graeber’s masterful Debt: The First 5,000 Years (2011), which demonstrates how debt has been used as a tool of political control.19 Stross’s protagonist is a scholar of accounting practices and, as she unravels a mystery related to a lost colony and appropriated assets, she educates readers about three kinds of money in this future: fast money is used for daily transactions, and is similar to currency as we recognize it; medium money is a fixed asset, something that can serve as a stable store of value over a long duration, necessary for civilizations that involve the time dilation of interstellar travel; and finally slow money is currency traded between interstellar civilizations, a universal currency that requires decades or more to complete a single transaction. The world Stross imagines needs all three kinds of money to accommodate trading across stellar distances. The larger thematic point has to do with how such financialized economies, always trading in terms of projected value, make debts into tradable assets, burdening a future that must pay debt generated by consumption in the present.

金·斯坦利·罗宾逊（Kim Stanley Robinson）也将负债作为其小说《纽约2140》（2017）的核心主题，这部小说同样探讨气候变化。到了2140年，这座城市已经适应了曼哈顿大部分地区被淹没的现实：水上交通占据了主导地位，人们只居住在摩天大楼的顶层。小说的情节由仍然居住在私有住宅中的富人与集体生活在合作社中、在消费主义减弱的经济中汇集资源的人们之间的紧张关系推动。结局是一场集体罢债——与债务如何成为金融化经济中财富创造引擎形成对比——拒绝偿还债务的行为最终摧毁了这个不公平的经济。罗宾逊将生态主题与经济主题相结合，证明了经济与其他技术一样，是一种以多种方式塑造未来的工具——因此，它成为科幻小说的一个恰当主题。

Kim Stanley Robinson also makes indebtedness central to New York 2140 (2017), a novel that is equally about climate change. By 2140 the city has adjusted to the fact that much of Manhattan is underwater: transport by water has taken over, and people live on only the highest floors of skyscrapers. The plot is propelled by tension between the wealthy, who still live in privatized residences, and those who live collectively in cooperatives, pooling resources in a less consumerist economy. The denouement involves a collective debt strike—countering how debt has become an engine of wealth creation in the financialized economy—a refusal to pay that crashes this unjust economy. Robinson’s combination of ecological and economic themes testifies to how much the economy is a technology like any other, a tool to shape the future in diverse ways—and thus an apt topic for sf.

9

9

结论：生活在科幻世界

Conclusion: Living in a Science-Fictional World

2017 年 12 月，科学杂志《自然》发表了题为《当未来就是现在》的文章，邀请六位当代科幻作家——劳伦·比克斯、金·斯坦利·罗宾逊、刘宇昆、汉努·拉贾尼米、阿拉斯泰尔·雷诺兹和阿丽特·德·博达尔——评论这一流派的重要性和发展轨迹。1他们收到了六个截然不同的答案，我希望读者现在已经预料到这个结果，这强化了人们的认识，即科幻并非单一事物；相反，它（长期以来）由各种各样的人动员起来，支持无数涉及通过故事创造未来的项目。 《自然》的作家名单选得很精良，不仅代表了对该流派的各种研究方法，也代表了当今对这一流派的全球认识：比克斯是南非人，罗宾逊来自美国，刘宇昆是美籍华人，拉贾尼米来自芬兰，雷诺兹来自英国，德博达德是法裔越南人。他们的回应表明，推动科幻小说发展的两大引擎——关注科技如何改变世界，以及想象不同的世界如何应对社会和政治问题——如今依然与科幻小说诞生之初一样强大。博克斯、罗宾逊和德博达德探讨了科幻小说如何应对气候变化、移民与难民以及社会经济变革；刘慈欣、拉贾尼米和雷诺兹则关注技术变革的迅猛，并始终探讨这些进步如何重塑人类社会。

In December 2017, the science journal Nature published “Science Fiction When the Future Is Now,” in which they asked six contemporary sf writers—Lauren Beukes, Kim Stanley Robinson, Ken Liu, Hannu Rajaniemi, Alastair Reynolds, and Aliette de Bodard—to comment on the importance and trajectory of the genre.1 They received six very different answers, an outcome I hope readers will have come to expect by now, reinforcing an understanding that sf is not a single thing; rather, it is (and has long been) mobilized by a range of people to support myriad projects that involve making our future through story. Nature’s list of writers is well chosen, representing not only a range of approaches to the genre, but also a global sense of the genre today: Beukes is South African, Robinson is from the United States, Liu is Chinese American, Rajaniemi is from Finland, Reynolds is from the UK, and de Bodard is French Vietnamese. Their responses reveal that the twin engines that propel the genre—engagement with how science and technology change the world, and imagining different worlds in response to social and political issues—remain equally powerful now as when the genre emerged. Beukes, Robinson, and de Bodard speak of ways that sf can address climate change, migration and refugees, and socioeconomic change; Liu, Rajaniemi, and Reynolds focus on the rapidity of technological change, always in dialogue with how such advances reshape human community.

所有人都认同科幻并非一种预测类型，但它确实与关于未来的理念息息相关，甚至可能尤其在具体细节出现错误时。例如，赛博朋克想象中的人类与科技融合，并非对当时涌现的技术的准确描述，但却有效且动人地捕捉到了我们当下现实中数字空间与物质空间的模糊。所有人都提出了关于科技的故事叙述对于正在经历快速变革的文化至关重要的原因。罗宾逊称科幻为“我们时代的现实主义”，并用3D眼镜的隐喻来解释科幻构建我们感知的独特方式：通过一个镜头，我们看到可能的未来，通过另一个镜头，我们看到现在，从而创造出一种同时关于现在和未来的类型。2科幻未来引人关注在我们决定如何使用技术、技术将惠及哪些人以及技术将赋能或取代哪些社会世界时，科技对我们积极创造未来至关重要。刘认为科幻小说关乎“在不断变化中保持人性”，3而雷诺兹则强调科幻小说在理解“动荡、变革和不可预测性”等未来必然因素方面发挥的作用。4我想补充一点，这就是为什么科幻小说既不同于企业对其工具和主题的挪用，又与之相关，例如科幻原型等等。这些作家都将科幻理解为一个塑造未来的文化项目，一种必须负责任地运用的力量。

All agree that sf is not a genre of prediction, but that it does have a relationship to ideas about futurity even, or perhaps especially, when it gets the specific details wrong. For example, the cyberpunk imaginary of humans fused with their technology is not an accurate image of technologies that emerged, but effectively—and affectively—captures the blurring of digital and material spaces that is our current reality. All suggest reasons why storytelling about technology is necessary to cultures undergoing rapid change. Robinson calls sf “the realism of our time” and offers the metaphor of 3D glasses to explain sf’s particular way of framing our perceptions: through one lens we see a possible future and through the other metaphors for the present, creating a genre simultaneously about today and the future.2 Science fiction futures draw attention to our active production of the future as we decide how to use technologies, whom they will benefit, and which social worlds they will enable or displace. Liu suggests sf is about “remaining human in the face of ceaseless change,3 while Reynolds highlights the genre’s role in understanding “turbulence, transformation, and unpredictability” as inevitable elements of the future.4 I would add that this is why sf remains distinct from, but related to, corporate appropriations of its tools and motifs as sf prototyping and the like. Each of these writers understands sf as a cultural project to shape the future, a power that must be used responsibly.

德博达尔强调，人们享受科学和工业技术进步的机会并不均衡，她认为科幻小说不仅关乎它们所创造的未来，也关乎“受益于科学进步和财富的人与落后者之间的巨大不平等”。她预计，进入 21 世纪，科幻小说和主流小说将“变得更加纠缠不清”，我同意这一观点。5亚当·罗最近在《福布斯》杂志的一篇在线文章中指出，科幻小说和奇幻小说的销量自 2010 年以来翻了一番，这一事实此前并未引起人们的注意，因为行业统计数据基于纸质书籍的销量，而忽略了仅以电子形式出版的作品。6虽然数量的增长并不意味着质量的提高，但这一趋势仍然表明科幻视野的影响力日益增强。

De Bodard stresses uneven access to technological improvements made available by science and industry, arguing that sf is about not only the futures they made possible but also about “the vast inequities between those who benefit from scientific advances and wealth, and those left behind.” She anticipates sf and mainstream fiction “becoming ever more entangled” into the twenty-first century, and I agree.5 In an online Forbes magazine article, Adam Rowe recently reported that sales of science fiction and fantasy have doubled since 2010, a fact that previously went unnoticed because industry statistics were based on print book sales, overlooking works published only in electronic form.6 While a growth in volume does not correlate to a growth in quality, this trend still points to the growing influence of sf visions.

本书探讨了“我们如今生活在一个科幻世界”这一常见论断究竟意味着什么，以及承认科幻与日常生活之间的互动如何改变了我们对这一类型的理解——事实上，这标志着科幻类型已经发生了变化。这种现实与科幻融合的感觉不仅受到新技术的推动，也受到推特、通过脸书窃取选举信息以及其他方式塑造的公共领域的推动，这些方式使得现实似乎越来越呈现出一种超现实的盈余。在我看来，“科幻小说”一词描述的并非是一种界限或多或少清晰的文学体裁，而是一种思考和感知的方式，一种用于概念化、干预和体验快速而广泛的社会技术变革的工具箱。随着科幻的文化影响力和贡献者范围的扩大，它也发生了无数次的变异：并非所有科幻创作者都对这一类型及其重要性有着相同的理解。因此，最后我要提醒读者，这本书既不是科幻史，也不是对其最重要作品的概述；相反，它是对科幻在我们当代文化想象中最为核心的场所的分析。7自始至终，我对探索科幻是什么不太感兴趣，而更专注于分析它能做什么。

This book has asked what the commonplace assertion that we now “live in a science-fictional world” might mean and how acknowledging exchanges between sf and everyday life changes our understanding of the genre—indeed, is a mark that the genre has changed. This sense of reality and sf merging is fueled not only by new technologies but also by a public sphere shaped by Twitter, elections hacked via Facebook, and other ways that reality increasingly seems to have a surreal surplus. In my approach, the term science fiction describes less a literary genre with more or less clearly demarcated boundaries and more a way of thinking and perceiving, a toolbox of methods for conceptualizing, intervening in, and living through rapid and widespread sociotechnical change. As sf has grown in cultural influence and in the range of people contributing to the genre, it has also mutated in myriad ways: not everyone creating sf shares the same understanding of what the genre is and why it matters. Thus I conclude by reminding readers that this book is neither a history of sf nor a survey of its most important works; rather, it is an analysis of the sites where sf is most central to our contemporary cultural imagination.7 Throughout, I have been less interested in exploring what sf has been and more focused on analyzing what it can do.

这种对当下科幻的关注，导致人们对曾经最具标志性的科幻类型——太空旅行和星际殖民故事——的关注度降低，我现在简要谈谈这一点。当然，这类科幻小说仍然存在。黄金时代科幻小说之所以如此受人怀念，主要原因之一或许在于，它的愿景与当代美国太空计划和登月计划不谋而合。美国国家航空航天局（NASA）一直与科幻小说保持着密切的关系，康斯坦斯·彭利（Constance Penley）的《NASA/星际迷航》（NASA/Trek）详细描述了这些实体是如何与大众想象紧密交织在一起的。8 1952年至1970年间，美国空军实施了“蓝皮书计划”，对所有与不明飞行物（UFO）目击事件相关的数据进行系统性研究，旨在确定这些目击事件是否对国家安全构成威胁。最终，由于判断任何不明飞行物（UFO）的证据都不可信，该项目悄无声息地结束了，并基本上被遗忘了。不过，最近历史频道虚构的系列剧《蓝皮书计划》（2019-）或许会重新唤起人们对这项看似难以置信却又真实存在的计划的兴趣。

This focus on sf of the present moment has resulted in a minimal focus on the kind of sf that was once most iconic, stories of space travel and interplanetary colonization, to which I now briefly turn. Certainly, this kind of sf persists. Arguably one of the main reasons the Golden Age sf is remembered so fondly is that its visions coincided with the contemporary American project of creating a space program and landing on the moon. NASA has always had a close relationship to sf, and Constance Penley’s NASA/Trek details how thoroughly these entities are entwined in the popular imagination.8 Between 1952 and 1970, the US Air Force conducted Project Blue Book, a systematic study of all data related to UFO sightings, aimed at determining whether they presented a threat to national security. Ultimately judging that no evidence of UFOs was credible, this project was closed without fanfare and largely forgotten, although the recent fictionalized History channel series Project Blue Book (2019–) will perhaps revive interest in this implausible, albeit true, initiative.

科幻小说描述了一种思维和感知的方式，一种概念化、干预和经历快速而广泛的社会技术变革的方法工具箱。

Science fiction describes a way of thinking and perceiving, a toolbox of methods for conceptualizing, intervening in, and living through rapid and widespread sociotechnical change.

1976年，美国国家航空航天局（NASA）发明了可再入和重复使用的航天器——航天飞机，开创了太空旅行的先河。《星际迷航》的粉丝们自豪地坚持要求将第一艘这样的航天器命名为“企业号”，以纪念柯克船长的著名飞船。《星际迷航》系列剧《企业号》（2001-2005）讲述了人类成为太空旅行物种的时代，其片头字幕进一步融合了历史与科幻，展现了飞行的影像，从莱特兄弟发明飞行器，到航天飞机计划及其后续发展，再到虚构的未来。1986年，航天飞机计划经历了第一次重大事故，挑战者号 起飞后不久发生爆炸，机上人员全部遇难，包括被选中参加“太空教师”计划的学校老师克里斯塔·麦考利夫。该计划旨在激发人们对 STEM 教育的兴趣和公众对 NASA 的支持。9悲剧发生后，NASA 在《纽约时报》上发表了一封致美国人民的公开信，直接向公众发出呼吁，呼吁读者倡导国会拨款重建失联的航天飞机，并表示这是纪念死者最合适的方式。这则广告由许多支持者签名，他们为巨额印刷费用做出了贡献，其中包括黄金时代科幻作家艾萨克·阿西莫夫和罗伯特·海因莱因。10在艺术模仿生活模仿艺术的持续循环中，Hulu 系列剧《第一》（2018 年）想象了一个新的火星殖民太空计划的早期阶段——值得注意的是，这一次是由私营企业而不是政府机构推动的——同样经历了由于部件故障而失去第一批机组人员和飞行器的考验。

In 1976, when NASA innovated space travel with a vehicle capable of reentry and reuse, the Space Shuttle, Star Trek fans proudly insisted that the first such vehicle be named Enterprise, after Captain Kirk’s famed vessel. The Star Trek series Enterprise (2001–2005), about the era when humans become a space-faring species, further conflates history and sf in its opening credits, which feature images of the invention of flight from the Wright brothers through the Space Shuttle program and beyond, into its fictionalized future. In 1986, the Space Shuttle program experienced its first major accident, when the Challenger exploded shortly after take-off, killing everyone aboard, including Christa McAuliffe, a schoolteacher selected to participate in the Teacher in Space program, designed both to inspire interest in STEM education and public support for NASA.9 In the wake of this tragedy, NASA reached out directly to the public in an Open Letter to the American People, published in the New York Times, which asked readers to advocate for Congress to allocate funds for rebuilding the lost shuttle, suggesting this was the most appropriate way to honor the dead. This advertisement was signed by a number of supporters who contributed to the huge printing costs, including Golden Age sf writers Isaac Asimov and Robert Heinlein.10 In the ongoing cycle of art imitating life imitating art, the Hulu series The First (2018) imagines the early years of a new space program to colonize Mars—notably, this time driven by private industry rather than government agency—similarly tested by the loss of their first crew and vehicle due to a faulty part.

国家地理系列剧《火星》（2016-2018）将科幻小说与正在进行的太空研究之间的这种构成关系更进一步。这部融合了纪录片、教育节目和虚构叙事的作品，背景设定在2033年至2045年之间，讲述了首次载人火星任务的宇航员们在火星上进行地球化改造和殖民的过程。该系列剧以斯蒂芬·佩特拉内克的著作《我们将如何在火星上生活》（2015）为蓝本，将虚构片段与对从事火星研究的科学家和工程师的采访相结合。现实世界中殖民火星的努力。该书的发布伴随着一本配套书籍《火星：我们在红色星球上的未来》（2016），提供了更多关于基础科学的信息。11

The National Geographic series Mars (2016–2018) takes this constitutive relationship between sf and ongoing space research a step further. A hybrid of documentary, educational program, and fictional narrative set between 2033 and 2045, it follows the crew of the first manned mission to Mars as they terraform and colonize the planet. Extrapolated from Stephen Petranek’s book How We’ll Live on Mars (2015), the series mixes fictional segments with interviews with scientists and engineers working on real-world efforts to colonize Mars. Its release was accompanied by a companion book, Mars: Our Future on the Red Planet (2016), that provides more information about the underlying science.11

这一系列为埃隆·马斯克的 SpaceX 计划做了更为直接的宣传，甚至超过了早期科幻小说对 NASA 的支持，以及国家地理播出的相关电视电影《火星：SpaceX 内部》（2018 年）。这是科幻小说、企业广告还是寓教于乐？考虑到科幻小说在当代文化中的作用，这些类别之间的重叠程度之广不容忽视，尽管我们也承认，这个特定的例子只是当今科幻小说众多用途之一。丽莎·梅塞里的民族志研究更接近于科幻小说作为一种社会想象的类型，她关注的是火星沙漠研究站那些准备执行此类任务的人，展现了小说与研究的另一种联系。这些科学家用科幻小说激发他们对火星生命的想象，通过他们富有想象力的观察方式，获得了对地球的新的时间定位，开始从地貌中看到数千年前的环境是如何孕育出当代形态的。通过富有想象力的投射和模拟火星生活的协议，研究人员将自己定位于火星殖民的未来，利用科幻语言来创造“推测未来的物质实例”。12这是科幻可以做的另一件事，它使新的体验成为可能。习惯性的感知和实践以及新的技术可能性。

This series creates publicity for Elon Musk’s SpaceX program even more directly than earlier sf provided support for NASA, and National Geographic aired a related television movie Mars: Inside SpaceX (2018). Is this science fiction, corporate advertising, or edutainment? Given how sf functions in contemporary culture, the overlaps among these categories are too extensive to overlook, even as we also acknowledge that this particular example is only one among many things that sf does today. Hewing closer to sf as a genre of social imaginaries, Lisa Messeri’s ethnographic work among those at the Mars Desert Research Station preparing to embark on such missions shows another nexus of fiction and research. Fueling their imagination with sf about life on Mars, these scientists gain a new temporal orientation toward Earth via their imaginative way of looking at our planet, beginning to see in the landscape how environments thousands of years ago gave rise to contemporary formations. Through imaginative projection and protocols that simulate living on Mars, researchers position themselves in a future of Martian colonization, drawing on the language of sf to create “a material instantiation of a speculative future.”12 This is another thing that sf can do, enabling new experiences of habituated perception and practice as much as new technological possibilities.

因此，太空旅行和“火箭飞船”仍然是科幻想象的一部分，但它们不再像过去那样定义这一类型。21世纪科幻小说的许多世界都接近于我们这一代人可能看到的未来，这一类型与根斯巴克倡导的新兴文学模式截然不同。它们也与新浪潮的超现实主义实验截然不同，后者试图疏远读者——而不是让他们接受——新技术如何改变日常生活。它们与因《星球大战》（1977）而广受欢迎的星际太空冒险题材再次不同，后者如今正重新受到人们的追捧。这些都是科幻小说，但彼此之间仍保持着独特的区别。

Space travel and the “rocket ship” thus remain part of the sf imaginary, but they no longer define the genre as they once did. Many worlds of twenty-first-century sf are close to futures we might see in our own lifetimes, a genre that is very different from the fledgling literary mode championed by Gernsback. They are very different as well from the surrealist experiments of the New Wave, which sought to alienate readers from—rather than reconcile them to—how new technologies were changing daily life. And they are different yet again from the intergalactic space adventures made popular by Star Wars (1977), now enjoying a renewed popularity. These are all science fiction while remaining distinct from one another.

我意识到，以这种方式描述科幻小说，我拒绝承认许多人认为重要的界限——科幻小说与奇幻小说、类型小说与文学小说、预测的思辨美学与艺术美学之间的界限。需要明确的是，我并非暗示本书所有的例子在意图或成就上都完全相同。然而，我发现更有益的做法是，将这些差异视为使用一套共同的工具来想象世界的方式，也就是说，将其视为为了不同目的而进行科幻创作的不同方式，从而产生出无数的文本和实践，最好将它们相互关联起来理解。我认为，将科幻小说视为一个由特征和……组成的网络，各种表述——近未来推断、远未来太空冒险、社会思想实验、新奇玩意儿的故事——提供了一种更稳健的理论来阐释这种文化模式的运作方式，即追踪各种文本和语境中的影响和反应。对各种界限的辩护过度地限制了我们理论化图像和主题如何在多个实践社群的调动和更新中传播的能力。

I am aware that in describing sf in this way I refuse to acknowledge boundaries that many deem important—between science fiction and fantasy, genre and literary fictions, speculative aesthetics of forecasting and those in art. To be clear, I am not suggesting that all of this book’s examples are identical in intent or achievement. I find it more useful, however, to think of such differences as ways of using a shared set of tools for imagining the world otherwise, that is, as different ways of doing sf—for different ends—that produce a myriad of texts and practices best understood in relation to one another. I contend that approaching sf as a network of features and representations—near-future extrapolation, far-future space adventure, social thought experiments, new gadget stories—provides a more robust way of theorizing how this cultural mode works, namely by following influences and reactions across a range of texts and contexts. The defense of various boundaries unduly limits our ability to theorize how images and motifs circulate as they are mobilized and renewed by multiple communities of practice.

某种程度上，这种多样性一直存在：HG 威尔斯并非有意创造一种新的文学体裁，而是使文学适应十九世纪末不断变化的环境，在那个时代，科学正在取代宗教，成为主导的文化叙事。戈什在论述文学小说未能概念化和应对气候变化时指出，科幻小说和其他类型小说被逐出受人尊敬的文学小说“庄园”的原因，部分在于科学与艺术文化之间关系的变化。13正如 C.P. 斯诺在其颇具影响力的著作《两种文化》（1959 年）中指出的那样，到二十世纪中叶，科学和人文学科已经分道扬镳，形成了截然不同、互不重叠的文化。14斯诺也预见了戈什的观点，认为这种知识隔离阻碍了人类解决最紧迫的问题。优秀科幻小说的优势在于，它能够涉足这两个世界。

To a degree, this variety has always been the case: H. G. Wells did not set out to produce a new literary genre, but rather to adapt literature to the changing circumstances of the late-nineteenth century, a world in which science was replacing religion as the dominant cultural narrative. Writing about the failure of literary fiction to conceptualize and respond to climate change, Ghosh suggests that the expulsion of sf and other genre fiction from the “manor house” of respectable literary fiction has to do in part with such changing relations between science and artistic culture.13 As C. P. Snow notes in his influential “The Two Cultures” (1959), by the mid-twentieth century the sciences and the humanities had become so separated as to constitute distinct and non-overlapping cultures.14 Anticipating Ghosh, Snow also argued that this segregation of knowledge was a hindrance to solving humanity’s most pressing problems. The strength of the best sf is that it keeps one foot in each of these worlds.

高什对小说整体价值的颂扬，其语言与描述科幻小说的语言非常相似。对他而言，小说使我们能够“以虚拟的方式看待世界，将其想象成与现实不同的世界：简而言之，小说巨大的、不可替代的潜力在于它使想象各种可能性成为可能”。15在另一个语境中，彼得·博克索尔在《小说的价值》（2015）中指出，这种文学形式之所以具有文化重要性，是因为它“构建世界的力量”和“对当前理解或构建的价值的抵制，它有权不以我们现有的术语来评判，而是以其自身能够召唤而生的未来形式来评判” 。16这些也是科幻小说的核心特质——构建世界、未来性、文化变革。在提及这些相似之处时，我并非声称所有文学都是科幻，也并非声称科幻小说在某种程度上捕捉到了文学整体的精华。我的观点是，科幻小说作为一种模式在21世纪文化中日益增长的存在，不仅是因为科技在日常生活中占据中心地位，也源于科幻小说与乌托邦传统及其社会变革计划的紧密联系。正如高雅文学文化开始认识到的那样，科幻小说可以成为一种重要的文化形式。

Ghosh extols the value of fiction overall in language that seems very close to a description of sf. For him, fiction enables us “to approach the world in a subjunctive mode, to conceive of it as if it were other than it is: in short, the great, irreplaceable potentiality of fiction is that it makes possible the imagining of possibilities.”15 In another context, Peter Boxall argues in The Value of the Novel (2015) that this literary form is culturally important due to its “world-making power” and “resistance to value as presently understood or constituted, its right to be judged not by the terms that we have available, but by those futural forms which it alone is able to summon into existence.”16 These too are qualities central to sf—worldmaking, futurity, cultural change. In drawing attention to these parallels, I do not claim that all literature is sf or that sf somehow captures what is best about literature overall. My point is that the increasing presence of sf as a mode in twenty-first-century culture is driven not only by the centrality of science and technology to daily life, but also by sf’s strong relationship to the utopian tradition and its project of social transformation. Science fiction can be a vital cultural form, as high literary cultures are beginning to acknowledge.

本书追溯了科幻小说从被视为一套叙事惯例和情节主题，到将其视为感知、理解和应对变化世界的方式的转变。它介绍了科幻体裁的一些历史背景，以便理解它在早期编辑和粉丝命名时是如何从一套更加多元的文化形式中诞生的。随着科幻潮流渗透到其他文化实践领域，这一发展轨迹可能正在发生逆转。虽然科幻作家和粉丝群体依然是一个知名的群体，但这个群体比最初的科幻粉丝群体规模更大、分布更广、成分也更加多元化，一些公众对科幻体裁的理解还未完全掌握这一事实。总而言之，套用克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯的话来说，科幻小说是很好的思考工具：17它是一种充满活力且日益流行的形式，非常适合我们今天生活的快速技术变革和全球治理体系。

This book has traced a transformation from thinking about science fiction as a set of narrative conventions and plot motifs to conceiving of it as mode for perceiving, understanding, and responding to a changeable world. It has included some context about the genre’s history as a way to understand how it emerged out of a more diverse set of cultural forms when it was named by early editors and fans, a trajectory that may be reversing itself as sf tendencies infuse other areas of cultural practice. Although there is still a recognizable sf community of writers and fans, this group is far larger, more distributed, and more heterogeneous than First Fandom was, a fact that some public understandings of the genre have yet to grasp. In sum, to paraphrase Claude Lévi-Strauss, science fiction is good to think with:17 it is a vibrant and increasingly prevalent form well-suited to the rapid pace of technological change and the global systems of governance that we live with today.

这段历史固然重要，但科幻小说的历史并非其发展极限，因为它不断演变，不断被新的声音所激发，并日益发现自己处于当代文化的中心而非边缘。这一点至关重要，不仅因为某些读者可能会对本书未提及特定文本或作者感到失望，也因为我坚信，现在正是科幻小说特别容易焕发新生的时刻。过去，当科幻作家和读者群体规模较小，科幻出版渠道也较为狭窄时，说他们是一个单一的群体是合理的。当然，当时也存在着紧张的关系和意识形态观点的分歧。在这个社群中，一些最重要的创新来自那些试图修改和重塑既有比喻的作家。然而，即使作家们竭力抗拒那些有影响力的编辑们强加的狭隘限制，或自身某些成员的短视观点，他们仍然拥有一个共同的核心知识，他们要么为此做出贡献，要么对此做出反击。

This history is important, but the genre’s history is not the limit of what it might do as it continues to change, enlivened by new voices and increasingly finding itself at the center rather than the margins of contemporary culture. This is a crucial point, not only because certain readers may be disappointed at not finding a specific text or author mentioned in these pages but also because of my conviction that now is a moment when the genre is particularly open to becoming something new. In the past when sf writers and readers were a smaller community and the venues for sf publishing were more circumscribed, it was plausible to speak of a single community. Certainly, there were tensions and differences of ideological opinion within this community, and some of the most important innovations came from writers who sought to revise and reinvent given tropes. Yet, even when authors strained against the parochial limits imposed by influential editors or the myopic visions of some of their own number, there was a shared core knowledge that they either contributed to or reacted against.

这种情况已经改变了。当代科幻最令人兴奋的事情之一，是它受到了越来越多来自不同背景和地域的人们的青睐。这些读者和作家往往通过日常生活和流行影视作品来吸收科幻知识，而不是通过阅读前辈大师的作品。18尽管有些人担心传统正在消亡，但这却是一个积极的发展，一个摆脱过去包袱、将科幻从一些不太光彩的时代中解放出来的机会，例如对殖民逻辑的延续、军国主义太空歌剧或欧洲中心主义的技术观念。那些因为生活在一个充满了曾经只在文本中预见的事物的世界而接触科幻的作家，并不会受到过去对这些技术及其未来的想象的影响。那些在非洲通过拉丁文化、与土著科学对话、或关注气候变化对穷人的影响来创造科幻传统的人——都为我们自认为了解的科幻类型创造了新的视角。

This has changed. Among the most exciting things about contemporary sf is that the genre is embraced by so many more people, coming from diverse backgrounds and geographical locations, readers and writers who often absorbed sf through daily life and from popular film and television, not through reading the Grand Masters who came before them.18 While for some this is cause for concern as tradition erodes, I see it as a positive development, a chance to throw off the weight of the past and free the genre from some of its least admirable moments, such as its perpetuation of settler colonial logics, its militaristic space opera, or its Eurocentric notions of technology. Writers who come to sf because they live in a world now filled with things once only anticipated in its texts are not influenced by how these technologies and their futures have been imagined before. Those inventing sf traditions in Africa, through Latinx culture, in dialogue with Indigenous science, or focused on the consequences of climate change for the poor—all create fresh perspectives on a genre we thought we knew.

科幻小说始终是一种具有两面性的话语，它既可以作为批判现实不公、启发更美好未来的工具，也可以用于让我们接受未来必然会延续我们现在的现状，即技术资本主义和社会不公。社会想象力、我们讲述的故事以及我们用故事构建的世界都至关重要。以电影《隐藏人物》（西奥多·梅尔菲导演，2016 年）为例，该片改编自玛格特·李·谢特利的同名小说，讲述了一位非裔美国女性凭借其数学技能确保了美国宇航局在太空竞赛初期取得辉煌成就的故事。19如果这些有色人种女性而不是白人男性宇航员成为太空竞赛的文化偶像，那么那个文化时刻将会有何不同？太空竞赛又将激发我们去想象和构建怎样的未来？当你思考这种差异会带来什么不同时，当你瞥见这个另一个可能的世界时，你就会理解科幻小说的力量，以及为什么它是当代生活的重要话语。

Science fiction remains a Janus-faced discourse, equally available as a tool to critique injustices of the present and inspire better futures or deployed to reconcile us to the inevitability of the future as a continuation of our present consisting of technologized capitalism and social injustice. The social imagination and the stories we tell, the worlds we build with our stories, matter. Consider the film Hidden Figures (Theodore Melfi, dir.; 2016) based on the eponymous book by Margot Lee Shetterly, about the African American women whose mathematical skills ensured NASA’s celebrated achievements in the early years of the Space Race.19 Had these women of color, rather than white male astronauts, been the celebrated cultural icons of the Space Race, how different would that cultural moment have been? What kinds of futures would the Space Race have inspired us to imagine and build? As you contemplate the difference such a difference would make, as you glimpse this other possible world, you grasp the power of science fiction and why it is an essential discourse for contemporary life.

社会想象力和我们讲述的故事以及我们用故事构建的世界都很重要。

The social imagination and the stories we tell, the worlds we build with our stories, matter.

致谢

Acknowledgments

本书中提出的思想，要感谢的人不胜枚举，感谢他们与我交流，最终形成了本书的理念。首先，我要感谢的是科幻研究领域本身。它激励我成为更优秀的思考者，即使有时令我感到沮丧，它仍然是我合作和完善思想的重要平台。Gerry Canavan、Grace Dillon、Paweł Frelik、David Higgins、Nalo Hopkinson、Roger Luckhurst、Colin Milburn、Hugh O'Connell、John Rieder、Steve Shaviro、Rebekah Sheldon 和 Taryne Taylor 都是我书中重要的对话者，他们不仅以敏锐的学术造诣，也通过友谊、社群和社群给予我支持。我要感谢《科幻小说研究》的编辑同事Istvan Csicsery-Ronay Jr.、Art Evans、Joan Gordan、Veronica Hollinger、Carol McGuirk 和 Lisa Swanstrom，感谢他们的友爱精神和智慧榜样。

The list of people to whom I owe thanks for conversations that have shaped the ideas represented in this book is immense, and so my first expression of gratitude is simply to the field of sf studies itself, which has challenged me to become a better thinker and, even when it frustrated me, served as an important space for collaboration and refinement of ideas. Gerry Canavan, Grace Dillon, Paweł Frelik, David Higgins, Nalo Hopkinson, Roger Luckhurst, Colin Milburn, Hugh O’Connell, John Rieder, Steve Shaviro Rebekah Sheldon, and Taryne Taylor have been important interlocutors, and also sustained me through friendship and community alongside their astute scholarship. I owe thanks to my fellow editors at Science Fiction Studies, Istvan Csicsery-Ronay Jr., Art Evans, Joan Gordan, Veronica Hollinger, Carol McGuirk, and Lisa Swanstrom, and am grateful for their camaraderie and intellectual example.

我特别感谢我的编辑苏珊·巴克利 (Susan Buckley) 邀请我参与这个项目并在整个过程中提供有益的指导。

I owe special thanks to my editor, Susan Buckley, for inviting me to work on this project and for helpful guidance throughout the process.

最后，我要感谢“思辨小说与科学文化”项目过去和现在的研究生们。他们用该领域的前沿研究启发了我，他们的研究成果展现了科幻小说未来可能的发展方向。这本书反映了我有幸与他们共事期间每天看到的科幻小说未来的可能性。

Finally, I thank my graduate students, past and present, in the Speculative Fictions and Cultures of Science Program. They inspire me with cutting-edge research in the field, work that embodies the range of things that the genre may yet become. This book reflects the possibilities for science fiction’s futures that I see daily as I have the privilege of working with them.

词汇表

Glossary

情感/情感

在批判性话语中用作名词，描述人们如何被激励去行为或做出选择，情感描述了情绪或感觉在影响人们行为中的作用；它与逻辑或理性相对照，是一种激励力量。

Affect/affective

Used as a noun in critical discourse about how people are motivated to behavior or make choices, affect describes the role of emotion or feeling in influencing what people do; it is used in contrast to logic or reason as motivational forces.

认知疏离：

达科·苏文（Darko Suvin）对科幻小说的长期定义，其中“认知”指的是观念或知识（苏文将其理解为“科学”），“疏离”指的是与小说世界截然不同的意外或陌生感。该术语源于“疏离”，即一种异化效应，贝托尔特·布莱希特（Bertolt Brecht）将其理论化为艺术的一项重要功能——即让观众对熟悉的事物感到陌生——从而以全新的视角看待我们习以为常的事物。

Cognitive estrangement

A longstanding definition of science fiction by Darko Suvin, in which “cognitive” refers to ideas or knowledge (understood as “science” by Suvin) and “estrangement” refers to the sense of the unexpected or unfamiliar associated with the different world of the fiction. The term has its roots in estrangement as a kind of alienation effect, theorized by Bertolt Brecht as an important function of art—that is, to make the familiar strange to audiences—thereby to see what we take for granted in a new way.

赛博朋克

是科幻小说的一个重要分支，兴起于20世纪80年代。“赛博”指的是计算机和其他IT技术，尤其是虚拟现实；“朋克”则指的是朋克摇滚相关的反建制价值观。赛博朋克中的黑客英雄们运用他们的IT技能，抵制并重新定位企业文化对IT的使用，正如朋克音乐以意想不到的方式运用其产品来批判消费主义文化一样。

Cyberpunk

An important subgenre of science fiction that emerged in the 1980s, the cyber refers to computers and other IT, especially virtual reality, and the punk to the anti-establishment values associated with punk rock. The hacker heroes of cyberpunk used their skills with IT to reject and reorient its uses by corporate culture, just as punk music commented on consumerist culture by using its products in unintended ways.

衍生品：

该术语的词根含义源于其他来源，用于描述以可交易股票形式流通的金融工具。衍生品的价值并非与标的物质资产挂钩，而是与标的且不断变化的金融资产（例如股票、市场指数的价值、利率等）挂钩。

Derivatives

The root meaning of the term is something based on another source, and it is used to describe financial instruments that circulate as tradeable stocks. Instead of being linked to an underlying material asset, the value of derivatives is linked to an underlying and ever-changing financial asset such as a stock, the value of market indexes, interest rates, and the like.

粉丝圈（Fandom

）指的是一群热情拥护者（粉丝）组成的亚文化群体，该词在科幻小说中有着特殊含义，因为粉丝在科幻小说流派的发展史上扮演着非常重要的角色。早期的粉丝会制作非正式的通讯（同人志），这些通讯的传播营造了一种社群氛围，并提供了是分析该类型作品的首选语言。最早的粉丝大会是草根活动，作家、编辑和粉丝经常会互换参与，这些会议源于当地组织的粉丝社团。粉丝圈是许多如今影响深远的机构的起源，例如颁发雨果奖的世界科幻大会 (WorldCon)，以及成立于1977年的威斯康星州科幻大会 (WisCon)，后者是“Otherwise奖”（表彰性别多样性）和“Carl Brandon奖”（表彰反对种族主义的作品）的发源地。粉丝研究本身已成为一个颇具影响力的学术领域，通常关注互联网时代的粉丝圈和粉丝小说（包括印刷品和其他媒体），这是一种扩展或改写文本以反映粉丝希望在文本虚构世界中看到的价值观和观点的实践。粉丝圈曾经是一个相当融合的社群，如今已成为一个庞大的机构，其中包含各种亚文化。

Fandom

A term used to describe a subculture of enthusiastic advocates (fans), the term has a particular meaning within science fiction, where fans have played a very significant role in the genre’s history. Early fans produced informal newsletters (fanzines) whose circulation created a sense of community and provided the first language for analysis of the genre. The first fan conventions were grassroots events within which writers, editors, and fans were often interchangeable, and these meetings grew out of locally organized fan societies. Fandom was the origin of many institutions that are hugely influential today, such as WorldCon, which presents the Hugo Awards, and the WisCon feminist convention, founded in 1977, home of the Otherwise Award (recognizing gender diversity) and the Carl Brandon Award (recognizing works countering racism). Fan studies have become an influential area of scholarship in its own right, often focusing on Internet-era fandom and fan fictions (in print and other media), a practice of extending or rewriting texts to reflect values and perspectives that fans wish to see as part of the text’s fictional universe. Once a fairly integrated community, fandom is now a large institution with a variety of subcultures within in.

黄金时代：

20世纪30年代末至50年代的出版业时期，传统上被认为是科幻小说发展成熟的时期。在此期间，科幻小说从低俗杂志转型为平装系列，许多早期小说被汇编成多个相互关联的系列。成为该类型著名创始人的作家们在这一时期出版了他们最著名的作品，主要是艾萨克·阿西莫夫、阿瑟·克拉克、菲利普·K·迪克和罗伯特·海因莱因。这一时期很大程度上受到约翰·W·坎贝尔在编辑领域的主导地位的影响，标志着雨果·根斯巴克的离开。

Golden Age

The period of publishing from the late 1930s to the 1950s that has traditionally been seen as the period when science fiction developed its mature form. The genre made the transition from pulp magazines into paperback series during this period, with many early novels being compilations of several linked series. Writers who became celebrated originators of the genre published their most celebrated works during this period, chiefly Isaac Asimov, Arthur C. Clarke, Philip K. Dick, and Robert Heinlein. This period is largely shaped by the editorial dominance of John W. Campbell and marks a move away from Hugo Gernsback.

霸权：

批判理论中的一个术语，主要与安东尼奥·葛兰西的著作相关，描述某种思想或信仰体系的领导地位或主导地位。葛兰西用该术语来解释民主社会中不平等的权力关系是如何维持的（与独裁统治所使用的武力相对）。

Hegemony

A term used in critical theory, chiefly associated with the work of Antonio Gramsci, it describes leadership or dominance of an idea or set of beliefs. Gramsci uses the term to explain how unequal power relationships are sustained in democratic societies (in contrast to the force used by dictatorships).

盗贼

统治 与“kleptomania”（“klepto”在希腊语中是盗窃的意思）有着相同的词根，指的是精英阶层利用政治权力来增加自身财富而不是为国家或公民服务的一种政府模式。

Kleptocracy

Sharing the same root as “kleptomania” (“klepto” means theft in Greek), this is a term for a mode of government by an elite who use their political power to enhance their own wealth rather than to serve the nation or its citizens.

劳动力

卡尔·马克思用劳动力来指在雇佣劳动条件下在市场上出售的劳动能力，这一术语标志着马克思的一个重要区别人类的自然活动（劳动）与当人的这一部分在市场上作为交换商品（劳动力）被非个人地出售时随之而来的异化之间。

Labor-power

Used by Karl Marx to refer to the work capacity that is sold on the market in conditions of wage labor, the term marks a distinction important to Marx between the natural activity of humanity (labor) and the alienation that follows when this part of one’s self is impersonally sold as an interchangement commodity on the market (labor-power).

新浪潮：

一个推广一系列全新美学和主题理念的术语，它已被应用于电影、流行音乐和科幻小说的各个领域。在科幻小说领域，它指的是20世纪60年代和70年代的一场运动，这场运动将科幻小说与当代反文化运动明显地联系在一起。新浪潮也关注文学风格和形式实验，因此标志着科幻小说的转变，人们更多地将科幻小说理解为一种特定的审美文化形式，而非对科学普遍兴趣的延伸，类似于加入火箭俱乐部之类的活动。

New Wave

A term marketing a new set of aesthetic and thematic concerns, it has been applied to all of cinema, pop music, and science fiction. In this last context, it names a movement in the 1960s and 1970s that overtly linked the genre with contemporary countercultural movements. The New Wave was also concerned with literary style and formal experimentation and thus marks a shift within science fiction, understanding the genre more as a specific aesthetic cultural form rather than as an extension of interest in science generally, aligned with things like membership in rocketry clubs.

思辨性

：该术语最基本的意思是“推测性的”，指基于推断而非确定性知识的呈现。它也有“假设的”或“不确定的”之意，因此与赌注和风险联系在一起（例如在投机性金融中）。在科幻小说界，它有时比形容词“科学”更受青睐，用来描述那些不同于现实主义描述、但并非总是基于科学推断的小说。该术语起源于罗伯特·海因莱因1947年的一篇文章，旨在表明科幻小说关注的是更广泛的社会问题，而不仅仅是关于最新奇玩意儿的故事。它后来被更广泛地用于描述新浪潮中更具超现实主义风格的美学，如今仍被广泛使用，通常用来表示科幻、奇幻和恐怖小说之间的类型界限。对于那些批评科学概念参与殖民主义排斥非西方知识和观点的历史的作家来说，不愿使用“科幻”一词尤为重要。

Speculative

Most basically, the term means “conjectural,” or refers to presentations based on extrapolation rather than certain knowledge. It also has the meaning of “hypothetical” or “uncertain,” and thus has come to be associated with wagers and risks (as in speculative finance). Within science fiction communities, it is sometimes preferred over the adjective “science” to describe fiction that differs from realist depiction, but not always based on scientific extrapolation. The term dates back to a 1947 essay by Robert Heinlein, meant to convey that the genre was interested in larger social questions, not just stories about the latest new gadget. It came into wider use to describe the more surrealist aesthetics of the New Wave, and is widely used today, often as a term that refuses genre boundaries among science fiction, fantasy, and horror. The reluctance to use the term science fiction is especially important in the work of writers who critique histories in which science as a concept has been complicit in colonial dismissals of non-Western knowledge and perspectives.

剩余价值：

卡尔·马克思用来解释产品生产成本与市场售价之间的差额的术语——利润就是这两个价格之间的差额。这一概念是马克思理论的核心，因为他认为这种差额源于对工人的剥削（从工人身上榨取剩余价值）。资本家希望支付尽可能少的钱，但由于对马克思来说，人类劳动是价值的唯一来源，因此产品的价格总是代表其实物材料+生产该产品的劳动：因此，只有向工人支付低于其实际贡献的工资，才能实现制造价格与市场价格之间的差异。

Surplus value

A term used by Karl Marx to explain the difference between what it costs to make a product and the price at which that product sells on a market—profit is the difference between these two prices. The idea is key to Marx’s theory, because he argues that this difference comes from exploiting the workers (extracting surplus value from them). The capitalist wants to pay as little as possible, but since human labor is the only source of value for Marx, the price of the product always represents its physical materials + the labor to make it: thus, a difference in manufacturing price vs. market price can only be achieved by paying the workers less than their true contribution.

技术官僚主义

一种以技术专家精英统治和领导为基础的政府形式，在科幻小说中，这些专家通常被理解为技术本身的专家。

Technocratic

A form of government based on rule and leadership by an elite of technical experts, generally understood to be experts in technology itself within science fiction contexts.

地球化

：科幻小说中出现的一个术语，用来描述改变行星环境和生态系统的工程过程，通常用于描述将行星改造得更像地球，以便人类殖民。该术语首次出现在1942年出版的一篇小说中。

Terraform

A term developed within science fiction to describe the engineering processes by which a planet’s environment and ecosystem is changed, usually used to describe making a planet more like Earth to enable human colonization. First used in a story published in 1942.

比喻（Trope）：

文学研究中指语言的比喻性运用。它可以统称一系列具有特定或狭义含义的修辞手法（例如隐喻、明喻、转喻等），也用于指代反复出现的主题或思想，例如低俗科幻小说中“天才发明家”的比喻。

Trope

A term in literary study used to refer to a figural use of language. It can collectively describe a range of techniques that each have specific and more narrow meanings (metaphor, simile, metonymy, etc.) and is also used to refer to a recurrent theme or idea, such as the “genius inventor” trope of pulp science fiction.

笔记

Notes

第一章

Chapter 1

1 .雨果·根斯巴克（Hugo Gernsback），“一种新的杂志”，《惊奇故事1》，第 1 期。 1（1926 年 4 月）：3。

1. Hugo Gernsback, “A New Sort of Magazine,” Amazing Stories 1, no. 1 (April 1926): 3.

2.约翰·里德，《论科幻或不论科幻：类型理论、科幻与历史》，《科幻研究》第27卷，第3期（2010年7月）：191-209页。另请参阅其著作《科幻小说与大众文化类型体系》（康涅狄格州米德尔顿：卫斯理大学出版社，2017年）。

2. John Rieder, “On Defining SF, or Not: Genre Theory, SF, and History,” Science Fiction Studies 27, no. 3 (July 2010): 191–209. See also his Science Fiction and the Mass Cultural Genre System (Middleton, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2017).

3.玛格丽特·阿特伍德，《在另一个世界：科幻与人类的想象力》（纽约：Anchor Books，2012年）。她进一步解释说，她将“不可能”的传统与儒勒·凡尔纳的“不可能”传统区分开来，她认为后者与赫伯特·乔治·威尔斯有关，而凡尔纳则致力于描写极有可能发生的技术进步（6）。根斯巴克本人将威尔斯、凡尔纳和埃德加·爱伦·坡并列，认为他们是他所致力于培育的科幻模式的先驱。然而，凡尔纳的观点更接近阿特伍德，他不愿与威尔斯混为一谈，正是因为他们对当代科学的理解截然不同。参见马克·博尔德和雪莉·文特合著的《劳特利奇科幻简史》（伦敦：劳特利奇，2011年），第13页。

3. Margaret Atwood, In Other Worlds: SF and the Human Imagination (New York: Anchor Books, 2012). She goes on to explain that she differentiates a tradition of “the impossible,” which she associates with H. G. Wells, from one that descends from Jules Verne, whom she understands to write about technological advances that very well could happen (6). Gernsback himself yoked Wells and Verne together, alongside Edgar Allan Poe, as practitioners avant la lettre of the mode he sought to cultivate. Verne, however, was closer to Atwood’s view and objected to being conflated with Wells precisely because they drew on contemporary science very differently. See Mark Bould and Sherryl Vint, The Routledge Concise History of Science Fiction (London: Routledge, 2011), 13.

4.请参阅 Sherryl Vint，《科学文化》，载《牛津科幻手册》 ，Rob Latham 编（牛津：牛津大学出版社，2014 年），第 305–316 页。

4. See Sherryl Vint, “The Cultures of Science,” in The Oxford Handbook to Science Fiction, ed. Rob Latham (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2014), 305–316.

5. Gary K. Wolfe，《蒸发的流派：奇幻文学论文集》（康涅狄格州米德尔敦：卫斯理大学出版社，2011 年）。

5. Gary K. Wolfe, Evaporating Genres: Essays on Fantastic Literature (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2011).

6. Istvan Csicsery-Ronay Jr.，《科幻七美》（康涅狄格州米德尔顿：卫斯理大学出版社，2011 年）。

6. Istvan Csicsery-Ronay Jr., The Seven Beauties of Science Fiction (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2011).

7.小说的结局，地球的微生物环境对在不同的星球环境下进化的火星物种来说是致命的，当然，这是从已知科学中更直接地推断出来的。在当今时代，当像埃隆·马斯克这样的技术专家大肆宣传火星殖民是人类唯一可行的未来时，这些问题仍然紧迫：天体生物学领域以及美国国家航空航天局和其他航天机构的行星保护办公室正在考虑行星间微生物转移的后果。迈克尔·克莱顿广受欢迎的电影《仙女座菌株》（1969）被改编成电影和电视剧，从相反的角度探讨了病毒污染的概念，即一颗流星在地球上引发了疫情。金·斯坦利·罗宾逊的《极光》（2015）强烈反驳了人类殖民火星的幻想。通过提请人们注意这样一个事实，即我们的生物功能依赖于我们进化过程中的微生物环境。

7. The novel’s conclusion, of course, in which the microbial environment of Earth proves fatal to Martian species who evolved in a different planetary context, extrapolates in a more straightforward way from known science. In our present moment, when colonizing Mars is hyped by technologists such as Elon Musk as the only viable future of humanity, these questions remain pressing: the field of astrobiology and offices of planetary protection in NASA and other space agencies consider the consequences of microbial transfer between planets. Michael Crichton’s popular The Andromeda Strain (1969), adapted for film and television, explored the idea of viral contamination from the opposite perspective, when a meteor creates an outbreak on Earth. Kim Stanley Robinson’s Aurora (2015) aggressively counters the fantasy of human colonization of other planets by drawing attention to the fact that we are dependent on the microbial environment within which we evolved for our biological functioning.

8.作家RA拉弗蒂，引自迈克·阿什利著《永恒之门：1970年至1980年的科幻杂志的故事》（利物浦：利物浦大学出版社，2007年），第15页。

8. Writer R. A. Lafferty, quoted in Mike Ashley, Gateways to Forever: The Story of the Science Fiction Magazines from 1970 to 1980 (Liverpool: Liverpool University Press, 2007), 15.

9 . Darko Suvin，《科幻小说的变形：论一种文学流派的诗学和历史》，Gerry Canavan 编（都柏林：Ralahine Utopian Studies，2017 年），第 15 页（原文重点）。

9. Darko Suvin, Metamorphoses of Science Fiction: On the Poetics and History of a Literary Genre, ed. Gerry Canavan (Dublin: Ralahine Utopian Studies, 2017), 15; emphasis in original.

10.请参阅 Mark Bould 和 China Miéville 编，《红色星球：马克思主义与科幻小说》（康涅狄格州米德尔顿：卫斯理大学出版社，2009 年）。

10. See Mark Bould and China Miéville, eds., Red Planets: Marxism and Science Fiction (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2009).

11.弗雷德里克·詹姆逊，《进步与乌托邦；或者，我们能想象未来吗？》，《科幻研究》 9，第2期（1982年）：151。

11. Fredric Jameson, “Progress versus Utopia; or, Can We Imagine the Future?,” Science Fiction Studies 9, no. 2 (1982): 151.

12.詹姆逊，《进步》，153。

12. Jameson, “Progress,” 153.

13.卡拉·基林（Kara Keeling）的《酷儿时代》开篇《黑人的未来》（纽约：纽约大学出版社，2019 年）有力地说明了社会变革与企业未来之间的这种紧张关系在当今更加普遍。

13. The opening chapter of Kara Keeling’s Queer Times, Black Futures (New York: New York University Press, 2019) offers a powerful example of how this tension between socially transformative and corporate futures is even more prevalent today.

14. 2019年，由于人们对授予蒂普特里（爱丽丝·谢尔顿）奖项是否恰当存在担忧，该奖项更名为“否则奖”。谢尔顿以男性笔名小詹姆斯·蒂普特里（James Tiptree Jr.）出版作品而闻名，在此期间，读者误以为这位作家是男性，这引发了关于性别及其与科幻小说关系的广泛讨论。然而，在生命的尽头，谢尔顿先杀死了因病致残的丈夫，然后自杀。长期以来，这一行为被视为自杀协议，后来被残疾人活动人士视为护理人员谋杀的典型案例，导致该奖项更名。

14. It was renamed the Otherwise Award in 2019, following concerns about whether it was appropriate to honor Tiptree (Alice Sheldon). Sheldon is famed for publishing under the male pseudonym James Tiptree Jr. for several years, during which the audience believed the author to be a man—sparking a widespread discussion of gender and its relationship to sf. At the end of her life, however, Sheldon committed suicide after first killing her husband, who was disabled by illness. Long regarded as a suicide pact, this action was later viewed as an example of caregiver murder by disability activists, leading to the renaming of the award.

15.萨拉·勒法努（Sara Lefanu）的《世界机器的缝隙：女权主义与科幻小说》（伦敦：妇女出版社，1988年）一书，书名取自蒂普特里（Tiptree）的《男人看不见的女人》（The Women Men Don't See，1973年），概述了女权主义者转向科幻小说的方式和原因。蒂普特里是作家爱丽丝·谢尔顿（Alice Sheldon）的笔名，她曾以男性笔名发表过一些著名小说，其“真实”性别曝光后震惊了整个科幻界。布里特·鲁塞特 (Britt Rusert) 的《逃亡科学：早期美国文化中的经验主义和自由》 (纽约：纽约大学出版社，2017 年) 有力地论证了非裔美国人创作的早期科幻小说，例如马丁·德拉尼 (Martin Delany) 的《布莱克或美国的小屋》 (1859 年)，以及科学知识的舞台表演，例如威廉·博克斯·布朗 (William Box Brown) 的讲座，都是批判塑造某些当代科学的误导性言论的科幻小说，尤其是那些声称从生物学上证明非洲人身体低劣以及因此非洲人民族低劣的言论。

15. Sara Lefanu’s In the Chinks of the World Machine: Feminism and Science Fiction (London: Women’s Press, 1988), which takes its title from Tiptree’s “The Women Men Don’t See” (1973), offers an overview of how and why feminists have turned to sf. Tiptree, the pseudonym for writer Alice Sheldon, published celebrated stories under her masculine pseudonym, shocking the community when her “true” gender was revealed. Britt Rusert’s Fugitive Science: Empiricism and Freedom in Early American Culture (New York: New York University Press, 2017) compellingly argues that early sf by African Americans, such as Martin Delany’s Blake, or the Huts of America (1859), alongside stage performances of scientific knowledge such as lectures by William Box Brown, were kinds of science fiction that critiqued the misleading discourse shaping certain contemporary sciences, especially claims to biologically prove the inferiority of African bodies and hence peoples.

16. adrienne maree brown 和 Walidah Imarisha 编，《奥克塔维亚的后代：来自社会正义运动的科幻故事》（奥克兰：AK 出版社，2015 年）。Shelley Streeby 编，《想象气候变化的未来：通过科幻小说和行动主义构建世界》（奥克兰：加州大学出版社，2018 年）。

16. adrienne maree brown and Walidah Imarisha, eds., Octavia’s Brood: Science Fiction Stories from Social Justice Movements (Oakland: AK Press, 2015). Shelley Streeby, Imagining the Future of Climate Change: World-Making through Science Fiction and Activism (Oakland: University of California Press, 2018).

17. Henry Jenkins，《公民想象力项目》，https://www.civicimaginationproject.org/about（2019 年 3 月 10 日访问）。

17. Henry Jenkins, The Civic Imagination Project, https://www.civicimaginationproject.org/about (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

18.安德鲁·米尔纳，《定位科幻小说》（利物浦：利物浦大学出版社，2012 年）。

18. Andrew Milner, Locating Science Fiction (Liverpool: Liverpool University Press, 2012).

19.请参阅《思辨小说翻译》，https://www.sfintranslation.com（2019年3月10日访问）。

19. See Speculative Fiction in Translation, https://www.sfintranslation.com (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

20.塞缪尔·R·德拉尼，《种族主义与科幻小说》，《纽约科幻评论》第120期，1998年8月，https://www.nyrsf.com/racism-and-science-fiction-.html（2019年3月10日访问）。德拉尼是二十世纪最杰出的非裔美国科幻作家，他探讨了自己在坎贝尔主编时期的经历。

20. Samuel R. Delany, “Racism and Science Fiction,” New York Review of Science Fiction 120, August 1998, https://www.nyrsf.com/racism-and-science-fiction-.html (accessed Mar. 10, 2019). Delany is the most prominent twentieth-century African American sf author and discusses his experiences under Campbell’s editorship.

21.Roger Luckhurst，《科幻小说》（伦敦：Polity，2005年）。

21. Roger Luckhurst, Science Fiction (London: Polity, 2005).

22. Future Tense，https://csi.asu.edu/future-tense/（2019年3月10日访问）。该中心的成立源于科幻作家尼尔·斯蒂芬森（Neal Stephenson）撰写的一篇关于创新与科幻想象力的文章《创新饥饿》（Innovation Starvation），世界政策研究所，2011年9月27日，https://worldpolicy.org/2011/09/27/innovation-starvation/（2019年3月10日访问）。

22. Future Tense, https://csi.asu.edu/future-tense/ (accessed Mar. 10, 2019). The Center was founded in dialogue with an essay about innovation and the sf imagination written by sf writer Neal Stephenson, “Innovation Starvation,” World Policy Institute, Sept. 27, 2011, https://worldpolicy.org/2011/09/27/innovation-starvation/ (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

23 . Sheila Jasanoff，《不完美的未来：科学、技术与现代性的想象》，载《现代性的梦境：社会技术想象与权力的制造》，Sheila Jasanoff 和 Sang-Hyun Kim 编（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，2015 年），第 4 页。

23. Sheila Jasanoff, “Future Imperfect: Science, Technology and the Imaginations of Modernity,” in Dreamscapes of Modernity: Sociotechnical Imagination and the Fabrication of Power, ed. Sheila Jasanoff and Sang-Hyun Kim (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2015), 4.

第二章

Chapter 2

1 .苏文，《变形记》，22。

1. Suvin, Metamorphoses, 22.

2.日期表示出版时间；两本书均在戈德温去世后出版。在《不同的引擎：科学如何驱动虚构》和《虚构驱动科学》（纽约：帕尔格雷夫出版社，2007年）一书中，尼尔·胡克和马克·布雷克认为，戈德温的作品对当时科学界关于外星生命存在可能性（或至少是宜居条件）的争论产生了重要影响，而这一争论的起因源于当时望远镜的发明。他们认为，这本著作影响了皇家学会第一任秘书约翰·威尔金斯的非虚构作品《在月球上发现一个世界》（1638年）。

2. The dates indicate time of publication; both were published posthumously. In Different Engines: How Science Drives Fiction and Fiction Drives Science (New York: Palgrave, 2007), Neil Hook and Mark Brake argue that Godwin’s work had an important influence on contemporary scientific debate about the possibility of life—or, at least, of habitable conditions—on other worlds, informed by the recent invention of the telescope. They suggest it influenced John Wilkins, first secretary of the Royal Society, in his nonfictional work The Discovery of a World in the Moone (1638).

3.参见史蒂文·夏平（Steven Shapin）的《科学革命》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1996年），其中更详细地讨论了这些转变及其更广泛的文化和政治影响。夏平开篇指出：“根本没有这样的首先，我首先将“科学革命”定义为“科学革命”（1），然后才继续解释如何以及为什么只有在回顾时，对世界向现代化转变的看法才会被视为一场革命——实际上是一个“单一”事件。

3. See Steven Shapin’s The Scientific Revolution (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1996) for a larger discussion of these shifts and their wider cultural and political implications. Shapin begins by arguing, “There was no such thing as the Scientific Revolution” (1) before proceeding to explain how and why a perception of a transformation of the world into modernity is seen as a revolution—indeed, as a “single” event—only in retrospect.

4.更多关于卡文迪什的自然哲学，请参阅黛博拉·道尔（Deborah Doyle）著《秩序井然的宇宙：玛格丽特·卡文迪什的哲学》（牛津：牛津大学出版社，2017年）。卡文迪什受益于贵族特权，同时也追求自身兴趣，是第一位参加皇家学会会议的女性。

4. See Deborah Doyle, The Well-Ordered Universe: The Philosophy of Margaret Cavendish (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2017) for more on Cavendish’s natural philosophy. Benefiting from her aristocratic privilege, but also pursuing her own interest, Cavendish was the first woman to attend a Royal Society meeting.

5.吉尔曼最出名的作品可能是她那本被广泛选集的哥特式故事《黄色壁纸》（1892 年），故事讲述了一个女人在心灵得不到任何刺激时发疯的故事；也就是说，对她的治疗是医生开的休息疗法，模仿了曾短暂治疗过吉尔曼的西拉斯·威尔·米切尔的做法。

5. Gilman is perhaps best known for her widely anthologized Gothic story “The Yellow Wallpaper” (1892), about a woman who goes mad when her mind is denied any stimulation; that is, her treatment is the rest cure prescribed by a physician and modeled on the practice of Silas Weir Mitchell, who briefly treated Gilman.

6.这部作品最初以短篇小说《当沉睡者醒来》（1898-1903）的形式连载，但威尔斯在以小说形式出版时对其进行了更新。伍迪·艾伦的讽刺电影《沉睡者》（1973）采用了类似的情节，批判了“未来必然会变得更好”的观点。

6. This work was originally serialized as a story, “When the Sleeper Wakes” (1898–1903), but Wells updated it when it was published in novel form. Woody Allan’s satirical film The Sleeper (1973) uses a similar plot to critique the idea that the future will inevitably be better.

7.这些分别改编自维罗妮卡·罗斯、詹姆斯·达什纳和亚历山德拉·布雷肯的书籍。

7. These are based on books by, respectively, Veronica Roth, James Dashner, and Alexandra Bracken.

8 . 刹车和钩子，《不同的引擎》，引用了奥威尔的《通往威根码头之路》（1937 年）及其对当时占主导地位的机械进步意识形态的强烈拒绝，他认为这种意识形态影响了威尔斯的乌托邦，而这些乌托邦后来被赫胥黎的反乌托邦小说《美丽新世界》所讽刺，Kindle loc. 1761 年。

8. Brake and Hook, Different Engines, cite Orwell’s The Road to Wigan Pier (1937) and his vehement rejection of a then-dominant ideology of mechanical progress, which he felt informed Wells’s utopias, which were then satirized by Huxley’s dystopian Brave New World, Kindle loc. 1761.

9.并非所有核战争后的反乌托邦都如此黯淡。帕特·弗兰克的畅销书《唉，巴比伦》（1959）表明，对于一些拥有自力更生、开拓进取精神的美国人而言，重建一个更美好的美国将相对容易。而小沃尔特·M·米勒广受好评的《莱博维茨的赞歌》（1959）则表明，只要科学知识得以保存，文明就能重建，尽管这需要几个世纪的时间。

9. Not all post–nuclear war dystopias were as bleak. Pat Frank’s bestseller Alas, Babylon (1959) suggests it will be relatively easy for some Americans with a self-reliant, pioneering spirit to rebuild a better United States, while Walter M. Miller Jr.’s well-regarded A Canticle for Leibowitz (1959) suggests that as long as scientific knowledge is preserved, civilization can be rebuilt, although it takes centuries.

10.汤姆·莫伊兰，《要求不可能：科幻小说与乌托邦想象》，拉斐拉·巴科里尼编（都柏林：拉拉希纳经典出版社，[1986] 2014），第10页。

10. Tom Moylan, Demand the Impossible: Science Fiction and the Utopian Imagination, ed. Raffaella Baccolini (Dublin: Ralahine Classics, [1986] 2014), 10.

11.莫伊兰，Demand，10。

11. Moylan, Demand, 10.

12.弗雷德里克·詹姆逊，《未来考古学：被称为乌托邦的愿望和其他科幻小说》（伦敦：Verso，2007 年）。

12. Fredric Jameson, Archaeologies of the Future: The Desire Called Utopia and Other Science Fictions (London: Verso, 2007).

13.埃里克·史密斯，《全球化、乌托邦与后殖民科幻：希望的新地图》（纽约：帕尔格雷夫出版社，2012年）。菲利普·E·韦格纳，《可能性的冲击波：论科幻、全球化与乌托邦》（都柏林：拉拉欣乌托邦研究出版社，2014年）。

13. Eric Smith, Globalization, Utopia and Postcolonial Science Fiction: New Maps of Hope (New York: Palgrave, 2012). Philip E. Wegner, Shockwaves of Possibility: Essays on Science Fiction, Globalization, and Utopia (Dublin: Ralahine Utopia Studies, 2014).

14.莱曼·塔尔·萨金特，《再论乌托邦主义的三个面孔》，《乌托邦研究》 5卷，第1期（1994年）：第26页。

14. Lyman Tower Sargent, “The Three Faces of Utopianism Revisited,” Utopian Studies 5, no. 1 (1994): 26.

15.乔安娜·拉斯，《像女人一样写作：女权主义和科幻小说论文集》（布卢明顿：印第安纳大学出版社，1995 年）。

15. Joanna Russ, To Write Like a Woman: Essays in Feminism and Science Fiction (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1995).

16.请参阅谢里·托马斯（Sheree Thomas）的《暗物质：非洲侨民思辨小说的一个世纪》（纽约：华纳图书，2000年），其中收录了恢复黑人思辨小说悠久传统的档案资料。学术期刊《乌托邦研究》（Utopian Studies）于2008年出版了一期关于巴特勒的特刊（19卷，第3期），由克莱尔·柯蒂斯（Claire Curtis）编辑。此外，还有大量探讨巴特勒与乌托邦思想关系的学术著作书目。

16. See Sheree Thomas, Dark Matter: A Century of Speculative Fiction from the African Diaspora (New York: Warner Books, 2000) for archival work recovering a longer tradition of Black speculative fiction. The academic journal Utopian Studies published a special issue (19, no. 3) on Butler in 2008, edited by Claire Curtis, and there is an extensive bibliography of academic works discussing Butler’s relationship to utopian thinking.

17.讽刺的是，这也是科幻小说主要是一个政治/社会项目还是一个科普项目的激烈争论导致科幻迷内部分裂的时刻之一。

17. Ironically, this was also one of the moments when intense fighting about whether sf is mainly a political/social project versus seeing sf as a project of science popularizing led to a schism in fandom.

18.史蒂芬·霍金，“我认为如果不进入太空，人类就没有未来”，《卫报》，2016 年 9 月 25 日，https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/sep/26/i-think-the-human-race-has-no-future-if-it-doesnt-go-to-space（2019 年 3 月 10 日访问）。

18. Stephen Hawking, “I Think the Human Race Has No Future If It Doesn’t Go to Space,” The Guardian, Sept. 25, 2016, https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/sep/26/i-think-the-human-race-has-no-future-if-it-doesnt-go-to-space (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

19.加来道雄，《人类的未来：火星地球化、星际旅行、永生以及我们在地球之外的命运》（纽约：Doubleday，2018 年）。

19. Michio Kaku, The Future of Humanity: Terraforming Mars, Interstellar Travel, Immortality and Our Destiny Beyond Earth (New York: Doubleday, 2018).

20.有关歌词，请参阅 Gil Scott Heron 的《Whitey on the Moon》，Genius，https ://genius.com/Gil-scott-heron-whitey-on-the-moon-annotated （2019 年 3 月 10 日访问）。

20. For the lyrics, see Gil Scott Heron, “Whitey on the Moon,” Genius, https://genius.com/Gil-scott-heron-whitey-on-the-moon-annotated (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

第三章

Chapter 3

1. Grant Wythoff，《事物的反常：雨果·根斯巴克论媒体、修补和科学化》（明尼阿波利斯：明尼苏达大学出版社，2016年），第2、3页。

1. Grant Wythoff, The Perversity of Things: Hugo Gernsback on Media, Tinkering, and Scientification (Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 2016), 2, 3.

2.请参阅约翰·程（John Cheng）的《惊人的奇迹：两次世界大战期间美国的科学与科幻想象》（费城：宾夕法尼亚大学出版社，2012年），其中详细介绍了早期通俗科幻小说如何探讨科学和公众问题，包括最后一章关于火箭俱乐部的内容。程还详细讨论了科幻迷之间的紧张和分歧，不仅涉及科幻的定义，还涉及专业和业余人士在科学和社会讨论中的地位。

2. See John Cheng, Astounding Wonder; Imagining Science and Science Fiction in Interwar America (Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2012) for a detailed history of how early pulp sf engaged with questions of science and the public, including a final chapter on rocketry clubs. Cheng also provides a detailed discussion of the tensions and schisms among fans, not only regarding definitions of sf but also regarding the place of professional vs. amateur voices in discussions of science and society.

3.请参阅 Marie Lavoie 和 James L. Addis，“利用增材制造技术的潜力：创业战略的挑战与机遇”，国际创新研究杂志2，第 4 期（2018 年）：123-136。

3. See Marie Lavoie and James L. Addis, “Harnessing the Potential of Additive Manufacturing Technologies: Challenges and Opportunities for Entrepreneurial Strategies,” International Journal of Innovation Studies 2, no. 4 (2018): 123–136.

4. Colin Milburn，《可改变的未来：实验台上的科幻小说》，Isis 101（2010）：560–569。

4. Colin Milburn, “Modifiable Futures: Science Fiction at the Bench,” Isis 101 (2010): 560–569.

5.威廉·吉布森，《燃烧的铬》，《燃烧的铬》（纽约：Ace，1986年），186页。

5. William Gibson, “Burning Chrome,” Burning Chrome (New York: Ace, 1986), 186.

6. Jasanoff，《未来》，第5页。

6. Jasanoff, “Future,” 5.

7. Jasanoff，《未来》，第11页。

7. Jasanoff, “Future,” 11.

8. Colin Milburn，《纳米视觉：工程未来》（北卡罗来纳州达勒姆：杜克大学出版社，2008 年）。

8. Colin Milburn, Nanovision: Engineering the Future (Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2008).

9. David Kirby，《未来就是现在：叙事原型和流行电影在推动现实世界技术发展中的作用》，《科学社会研究》 40，第1期（2010 年 2 月）：41-70。

9. David Kirby, “The Future Is Now: Diegetic Prototypes and the Role of Popular Films in Generating Real-World Technological Development,” Social Studies of Science 40, no. 1 (February 2010): 41–70.

10.有关这一富有想象力的组成部分如何与基因组研究中的风险投资资金交叉的更详细讨论，请参阅我的“期票未来：金融与虚构中的现实与想象”，载于“投机金融/投机小说”，由 David M. Higgins 和 Hugh C. O'Connell 编辑，特刊，CR：《新百年评论》 19 卷，第 1 期（2019 年）：11-36。

10. For a more detailed discussion of how this imaginative component intersects with venture capital funding in genomic research, see my “Promissory Futures: Reality and Imagination in Finance and Fiction,” in “Speculative Finance/Speculative Fiction,” ed. David M. Higgins and Hugh C. O’Connell, special issue, CR: The New Centennial Review 19, no. 1 (2019): 11–36.

11.该广告可以在 YouTube 上观看：Apple, Macintosh 广告，1984 年，https://youtu.be/axSnW-ygU5g（2019 年 3 月 10 日访问）。

11. The advertisement can be viewed on YouTube: Apple, Macintosh advertisement, 1984, https://youtu.be/axSnW-ygU5g (accessed Mar. 10, 2019).

12.朱利安·布利克，《设计小说：关于设计、科学、事实与虚构的短文》。近未来实验室，2009年，http://drbfw5wfjlxon.cloudfront.net/writing/DesignFiction_WebEdition.pdf（2019年3月10日访问）。布利克（下文将更详细地讨论）是最早用这些术语讨论这一场景的人之一。类似的视觉效果如今也出现在没有其他科幻元素的警匪剧中，例如重启版的《天堂执法者》（2010年至今）。

12. Julian Bleeker, “Design Fiction: A Short Essay on Design, Science, Fact and Fiction.” Near Future Laboratories, 2009, http://drbfw5wfjlxon.cloudfront.net/writing/DesignFiction_WebEdition.pdf (accessed Mar. 10, 2019). Bleeker, discussed in more detail below, is among the first to discuss this scene in these terms. Similar visuals are now used in police procedural television that has no other sf element, such as the rebooted Hawaii Five-0 (2010–).

13. David Brian Johnson，《科幻原型：用科幻设计未来》，《计算机科学综合讲座》 3，第 1 期（2011 年 4 月）：1-190。

13. David Brian Johnson, “Science Fiction Prototyping: Designing the Future with Science Fiction,” Synthesis Lectures on Computer Science 3, no. 1 (April 2011): 1–190.

14. Jerry Pournelle 和 Dean Ing，《相互保证生存》（纽约：Baen，1984 年）。

14. Jerry Pournelle and Dean Ing, Mutually Assured Survival (New York: Baen, 1984).

15 .布利克，“设计”，4。

15. Bleeker, “Design,” 4.

16 .布利克，“设计”，6。

16. Bleeker, “Design,” 6.

17. Anthony Dunne 和 Fiona Raby，《思辨一切：设计、小说和社会梦想》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，2013 年），Kindle 本地版。18.

17. Anthony Dunne and Fiona Raby, Speculative Everything: Design, Fiction, and Social Dreaming (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2013), Kindle loc. 18.

18 . Dunne 和 Raby，《Speculative》，Kindle 位置 371。

18. Dunne and Raby, Speculative, Kindle loc. 371.

第四章

Chapter 4

1.请参阅 Bould 和 Vint合著的《简明历史》，其中对科幻史的分析是，科幻史是拉图尔式的一项工程，旨在“吸收”关于科学和文化变迁的思维方式，并将其融入到 Gernsback 所倡导的新传统中。

1. See Bould and Vint, Concise History, for an analysis of sf history as a Latourian project of “enrolling” ways of thinking about science and cultural change to fuse them into the new tradition Gernsback championed.

2. Luckhurst，《科幻小说》，16-17。

2. Luckhurst, Science Fiction, 16–17.

3.约翰·里德（John Rieder），《殖民主义与科幻小说的兴起》（康涅狄格州米德尔顿：卫斯理大学出版社，2008 年）。

3. John Rieder, Colonialism and the Emergence of Science Fiction (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2008).

4. Rieder，《殖民主义》，第1卷。

4. Rieder, Colonialism, 1.

5. Rieder，《殖民主义》，第2卷。

5. Rieder, Colonialism, 2.

6. Rieder，《殖民主义》，7。

6. Rieder, Colonialism, 7.

7. Rieder，《殖民主义》，15。

7. Rieder, Colonialism, 15.

8.篇幅所限，本文无法对此传统进行深入探讨，但十九世纪后期涌现出许多描绘潜在入侵的近未来小说，通常讲述一个欧洲国家入侵另一个欧洲国家的故事，并着重探讨战争技术带来的差异。乔治·汤姆金斯·切斯尼的《多尔金战役》（1871年）或许是最著名的一部，该书讲述了一个伪装得毫不掩饰的德国入侵英国的故事。有关详细分析，请参阅IF Clarke著《预言战争的声音：未来战争1763-1749》（第二版）（牛津：牛津大学出版社，1992年；原版出版于1966年）。

8. Space precludes further discussion of this tradition, but the late-nineteenth century saw many works of near-future fiction about potential invasions, generally one European nation invading another, focused on the difference made by technologies of warfare. George Thomkyns Chesney’s The Battle of Dorking (1871), about the invasion of Britain by a thinly disguised Germany, is perhaps the best known. See I. F. Clarke, Voices Prophesying War: Future Wars 1763–3749, 2nd ed. (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1992; originally published in 1966), for a detailed analysis.

9. HG Wells，《世界大战》（伦敦：企鹅经典出版社，2005年）。

9. H. G. Wells, The War of the Worlds (London: Penguin Classics, 2005).

10.威尔斯，《战争》，5。

10. Wells, War, 5.

11.这句话出自原版系列的开场独白。当然， 《星际迷航》倡导的是科学探索而非军事探索的自由主义观点，其多元文化观的核心在于其首要指令：不干涉其他文化的独立发展。正如许多人所观察到的，在早期剧集中，这一指令往往更多地体现在对其违反的合理化解释上，而非其遵守上。然而，与此同时，对文化主权问题的关注也表明了殖民主义视角对科幻作品的渗透程度，以至于那些不支持帝国主义观点的作品也必须表明立场。温鲍姆的故事可以在古腾堡计划中找到。

11. The phrase is from the opening monologue to the original series. Star Trek, of course, championed a liberal view of scientific rather than military exploration of space and its multicultural view is epitomized by its prime directive of not interfering with the independent development of other cultures. As many have observed, in early episodes this directive is often conspicuous more for rationalizations of its violation than in its observance. At the same time, however, the perceived need to address cultural sovereignty shows how thoroughly the colonial gaze permeates sf, such that works that do not validate imperial views must nonetheless take a position. Weinbaum’s story is available on Project Gutenberg.

12.前十五篇小说，连同主编罗伯特·西尔弗伯格（Robert Silverberg）选出的其他小说，发表于《科幻名人堂，第一卷：1929-1964》（纽约：Doubleday，1970年）。西尔弗伯格在序言中列出了投票结果的排序。
